loans.name: Doborah

texts.en:
Deborah is married with seven children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her father). She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She has a restaurant business which she has been running for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and rice. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.   

She aspires to becoming a wholesaler and also to educating her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy  more bunches of green bananas, cassava, sweet and Irish potatoes, beef and rice

loans.name: Daysi Mirian

texts.es:
Daysi de 39 años de edad,  es una persona que estudio hasta sexto grado y es una persona casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Ella se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. Junto a su esposo, para realizar sus actividades diarias y sus 4 hijos le colaboran con las actividades diarias.

Daysi se dedica a comercializar mariscos, oficio que le ha enseño su madre, mientras su esposo trabaja en la parcela junto a sus hijos camina 2 kilómetros para llegar y en el transcurso de la tarde, ella se dedica a comprar mas mariscos para el siguiente día ir a vender. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar los insumos para sembrar (abono, semilla, pesticidas, etc) y podrá  obtener una buena cosecha y así incrementar sus ingresos.

Ella planea que con los ingresos que obtiene de la venta de mariscos y  del préstamo para la siembra podrá en un futuro  comprar  vacas.
texts.en:
Daysi, 39, is married and has a sixth grade education.  Her husband works in agriculture.  At 4:30 a.m., she and her husband get up to handle the daily chores and their four children help with the activity.

Daysi sells shellfish, a trade she learned from her mother.  Her husband works on farmland with their two children and walks the two km. to get to the field. In the afternoon Daysi buys shellfish to sell the next day.

The loan she is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy crop supplies (compost, seeds, pesticides, etc.) in order to produce a good harvest and increase her income.

With the income from shellfish sales and the crop sales, she plans to buy cows in the future.

loans.use: To buy crop supplies (compost, seeds, pesticides, etc.)

loans.name: Wilber Alexander

texts.es:
Wilber de 36 años de edad, es una persona casada, que estudio hasta sexto grado,  vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Se levanta a las 3:30 a.m. Junto a su esposa que le apoya en la actividades agrícolas durante la mañana y sus hijos asisten a la escuela.

 Wilber junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura oficio que aprendió de sus padres; para llegar a la parcelas camina 3 kilómetros y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a atender la pequeña tienda que poseen.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una novilla que  le ayudara en un futuro para incrementar la producción de leche para la venta y obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilber, 36, is married and has a sixth grade education.  He lives with his wife and two children.  He and his wife get up at 3:30 a.m. to attend to their agriculture business, a trade he learned from his parents.  He walks three kilometers to get to the fields where he works in the morning.  His wife takes care of the household chores and runs the small store they have.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a calf so that in the future he will produce more milk to sell to increase income for the family.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Emilly

texts.en:
Emilly is married with two children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her niece. She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for eight years. 

Emilly has applied for a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, beans, ground nuts and cooking utensils. Emilly works from home six days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

Emilly aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to buy a plot of land on which she can build her own house. Emilly resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, beans, ground nuts and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik lives in Gyumri with her husband, mother-in-law and two children (ages 8 and 4). 

Astghik is a teacher by profession; she works at a local school as a part-time worker. Her husband is a sportsman and winner of several international tournaments. 

Besides working at the school, Astghik is also involved in a retail business. She trades clothing and different dressmaking supplies in a small rented store. 
 
Astghik's mother-in-law helps her with running the store and they have a good client base. 

Astghik has now applied for this loan to purchase new stock of clothing for reselling at her store. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Astghik is very thankful to lenders for their support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing for reselling at the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more motor bike spare parts, motor oil and different kinds of spare parts.

loans.name: Boanerge Eliazar

texts.es:
Boanerge de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, actualmente está soltero y vive con sus padres y seis hermanos. Él es agricultor de profesión, pero actualmente se dedica a la atención al cliente en compra de terrenos desde hace cinco meses, además le ayuda a su padre en la siembra de maíz, el trabajo le queda a unos 10 metros de su casa y se va en bicicleta.

 El crédito lo invirtiera en la compra de materiales de construcción bloques, cemento arena, hierro, para ampliar la cocina y corredor la necesidad satisfecha es que en época de invierno el agua no entrar a la casa por el corredor, el sueño en un futuro es tener un local artesanal.
texts.en:
Boanerge is 23 years old. He went to school up to the sixth grade. Right now, he is single and lives with his parents and six siblings. He is a farmer, but right now he has been serving customers buying land for five months. In addition, he helps his father grow corn. His job is 10 meters from his house and he gets there on bike. 

She will invest the loan in buying construction materials such as blocks, cement, sand, and iron bars to expand the kitchen and corridor of his house. He needs to do this so that in winter water doesn't get into the house through the corridor. His dream for the future is to have a locale that sells artisanal crafts.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, sand, and iron rods to expand the kitchen and corridor of his house.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru:
Сайёра 29-летняя жительница района Хамадони, обладающая искусством шитья. Не так давно она начала профессионально заниматься этим делом. В этом году уже будет год как она берет заказы на пошив женских национальных платьев. Местом деятельности Сайёры является ее дом. Она успевает и присматривать за двумя своим детьми и вести домашнее хозяйство и одновременно заниматься шитьем. Муж Сайёры уехал на заработки в Россию, бросив всю заботу о доме и о детях на хрупкие плечи Сайёры. Но пока она успешно справляется со всем. 
Сайёра шьет заказные платья на своей старой швейной машинке, что затрудняет ее работу. Она запрашивает кредит и хочет приобрести новую модернизированную швейную машинку, что позволит справляться с работой быстро и качественно. Для реализации цели она полагается на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Sayora is a 29-year-old resident of the Hamadoni Distict who masters the skill of sewing. She began to do this trade professionally not too long ago. This year will mark one year since she has began taking orders for sewing ethnic Tajik women's dresses. Sayora runs this business from her home. She manages to look after her two children, run the household and simultaneously run her sewing business. Sayora's husband left to work abroad in Russia, placing all of the concerns about the household and the children on Sayora's delicate shoulders. However, she has managed everything successfully for the time being.

Sayora sews her dress orders on her old sewing machine which makes her work difficult. She is requesting a loan to purchase a new, modernized sewing machine which will allow her to do her high-quality work quickly. She relies on your support to accomplish her goal.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre  membres du groupe Benkola ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sebenikoro l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, d’amitié, de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sebenikoro.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes les pointures, habits et produits cosmétiques. Dans le but de constituer leurs stockes, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sali (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de chaussures plastiques (hommes et femmes) de toutes les pointures. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200 paires de chaussures de tous les âges au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail à et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sali compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en: With the majority of its members married into monogamous households, the four members of the Benkola Group have an average age of 38 and an average of three children each. They all live in Sebenikoro, one of the districts of Bamako, and they know each other through the bonds of family, friendship, community and their business activities at Sebenikoro Market. The members of the group sell plastic shoes (for both men and women) in all sizes, as well as well as clothes and cosmetic products. In order to amass more stock, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their third group loan. Sali, the woman standing to the far right of the photo, is the group's star seller. She is planning on using this loan to purchase 200 pairs of shoes at the main market. She will then travel the local area selling these shoes to a predominantly female customer base. Sali plans on generating an average monthly revenue of 60,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business and used to meet her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase plastic shoes

loans.name: Jose Jaime

texts.es: El señor José de 42 años de edad, recientemente divorciado, aún vive en la casa de su madre, ya que no pudo comprarse una casita propia, se separó de su esposa y sus 2 hijos se quedaron en custodia de su madre,  tiene un grado de instrucción de nivel técnico (mecánico industrial). Desde muy joven empezó a trabajar en todos los rubros, después de un tiempo encontró uno de los mejores trabajos según él,  ya que disfruta trabajar en su actividad que es el servicio de Tornería y soldadura con experiencia de 5 años y como actividad propia su experiencia es de un año y medio en el rubro, trabaja acompañado de su hermano ya que tienen un convenio verbal entre ellos. El presente crédito es para comprar herramientas y nuevas máquinas para su actividad, ya que con el pasar de los años se deterioraron, así podrá mejorar la calidad de su trabajo, y aumentar sus ingresos para mejorar las condiciones en las que se encuentra.
texts.en: José is 42 years old. He is recently divorced and still lives in his mother's house. He was unable to buy his own house. He separated from his wife and his 2 children remained in their mother's custody. He has had a technical education (industrial mechanics). When he was very young, he started to work in everything. Later, he found what is one of the best jobs, according to him. He enjoys working in his activity, which is turnery and welding. He has 5 years' experience, and a year and a half on his own. He works with his brother and they have a verbal agreement between the two of them. This loan is to buy tools and new machines for his activity, because over the years the ones he has have deteriorated. This way, he can improve the quality of his work and and increase his income in order to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy tools and new machines for his activity.

loans.name: Qurbonbi

texts.ru: Курбонби молодая и еще незамужняя девушка в возрасте 27 лет. Она живет с родителями. Ее отец мастер строитель, а мать домохозяйка. Курбонби имеет только среднее образование. Три года назад по совету знакомых она начала животноводческий бизнес. Курбонби во дворе своего дома выращивает бычков в течение месяца и затем по прибыльной цене продает на местном скотном рынке. Отец помогает в реализации скота. Сейчас Курбонби обратилась за кредитом, чтобы приобрести пару молодых бычков и увеличить поголовье скота. Она надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Qurbonbi is a 27-year-old unmarried young woman. She lives with her parents. Her father is a construction foreman and her mother is a homemaker. Qurbonbi only has a secondary education. On the advice of her friends, she started her own livestock breeding business three years ago. In the yard of her house, Qurbonbi raises bull calves over the course of a month and then sells them at the local cattle market at a profit. Her father helps her sell the cattle. Now Qurbonbi is requesting a loan to buy a pair of young bull calves to increase the size of her herd. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy a pair of young bull calves to increase her number of sellable cattle.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La Señora Patricia  tiene 34 años y es casada tiene tres hijos  de las edades de 10, 8 y 6 años, Erika se dedica a la Venta de ropa de segunda mano compra por fardo y lo vende por unidad, ella tiene su puesto de venta en la zona de Pampahasi  pero también vende en distintas ferias, Este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Patricia  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería un fardo de ropa, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo y necesita la mercadería   ya que esta época tiene mucha venta y por esta razón quiere abastecerse de mercadería, la señora Patricia   enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el tener que moverse de feria en feria, para vender sus productos, lo cual le genera inseguridad debido a que esto es un poco peligroso, y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería, la señora Patricia   es una persona joven con ganas de salir adelante de mejorar su negocio, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Patricia is 34 years old. She is married and has three children, aged 10, 8 and 6. Erika works selling used clothing she buys in bulk and sells by the unit.    She has a sales stall in the Pampahasi area, but she also sells in different markets. This loan is her first cycle in the institution. Patricia is going to use this loan to buy  a bundle of clothing. Her reason for asking for this loan is a lack of cash and a need for merchandise. During this season, she has a lot of sales and that is why she wants to stock up on merchandise. Patricia faces challenges in her business, such as having to go from market to market to sell her products. This generates insecurity because it is a little bit dangerous. She is going to use the profits to keep buying merchandise. Patricia is a young person who is eager to get ahead and improve her business. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Melvi Adonay

texts.es:
Melvi de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado,  está soltero vive con sus hermanos y su madre.
Melvi trabaja en una tejera y ladrillera, trabajo que le queda a 15 minutos en bicicleta desde su casa. El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar adobe, teja y madera, para el techo de su vivienda. Sueña con poder hacer mejor su casa, trabajar  y poder tener una familia  y darle una vida digna.
texts.en: Melvi is 26 years old. He went to school up to the fifth grade. He is single and lives with his siblings and his mother. Melvi works in a roof tile and brick business. His job is 15 minutes away from his house by bike. The loan he is asking for is to buy adobe, roof tiles and wood for his house' roof. He dreams of being able to improve his home and be able to have a family and give them a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy adobe and roof tiles for his house.

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон 40 лет, замужем, 5 детей, все дети взрослые и самостоятельные. У Чолпон среднее образование, она целеустремленна, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Чолпон знает, как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 22 лет занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 20 овец и 1 жеребенок. Для содержания скота имеются все условия. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чолпон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также планирует приобрести овец. Доходы от кредита Чолпон планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку земельного участка.
texts.en: Cholpon is 57 years old and married. She has five children, all of whom are grown-up and self-sufficient. Cholpon has a secondary education. She is goal-driven - she knows exactly what she wants and goes after it with all of her strength. Cholpon knows how to correctly use and manage money to achieve her stated goals. As the main course of income for her family, she has been practicing livestock breeding for 22 years. Thanks to Cholpon's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows, 20 sheep and 1 foal on her farm. She has all of the necessary conditions to house cattle. She has procured enough hay and cattle feed. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Cholpon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd as well as to buy sheep. Cholpon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep.

loans.name: Mosafar

texts.en:
A responsible woman by the name of Mosafar lives in a house which in in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who has very small salary. They have 2 clever children. Mosafar’s children want to live in a house in good condition but her salary is not enough for it. She works in a local hospital as a nurse. She must to repair all the rooms of her house but she does not have enough savings. She is asking for a loan of 7000 TJS to buy cement, wood, paint, and other building materials to repair her house.

In this way she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy cement, wood, paint and other building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet manages a hog raising business in their village. She is 33 years of age, married and has three children attending school. Juliet wants to take care of more piglets because she wants to earn more. Due to financial constraints, Juliet decided to borrow a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy there piglets to raise. Juliet chose our organization to borrow a loan because of our good service. She will use her loan wisely, managing her business well her to make it grow. She will prioritize to sustain her children education through her earnings from her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Toto

texts.en:
Toto is a private employee. He lives in Cirebon, a semi-urban area about 7 hours from Jakarta. Toto is married (in the picture, Toto is with his wife). To increase the family income, Toto also works as a dealer. He joined Ruma 1 month ago to increase his income. He feels really excited to be expanding his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers.

Toto is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much needed service in the area and will increase his income. To provide this new service, Toto is required to print out receipts for customers. A Kiva loan will help him to purchase a printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: to purchase a printer to be able to offer a new service processing electricity bill payments

loans.name: Sadokat

texts.en:
Sadokat was born in 1981. She is divorced and bringing up three children. Sadokat began her sewing business 5 years ago. She needed money to provide her children with all necessary things. Little by little, Sadokat has been improving living conditions with the profit from her business. She is trying to further develop the business because it is the only source of family income.

Sadokat is going to buy an embroidery machine and in this way attract more clients. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to buy an embroidery machine to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Miguel Àngel

texts.es:
Miguel de 69 años de edad, no estudio,  está casado, su pareja se dedica al trabajo de la agricultura y ganadería junto a su esposa tienen dos hijos que estudian, el cliente trabaja la agricultura  y ganadería trabajo que en su familia han realizado por años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y pesticidas, para realizar sus cultivos en el tiempo oportuno y garantizar el fruto de su cosecha para la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel, of 69 years old, didn’t go to school, is married, and his life partner works in agriculture and stockbreeding. Along with her, he has two children that attend to school. He also works in agriculture and stockbreeding. His family has performed these activities for several years. 

The loan he’s requesting from CREDICAMPO will be used to buy manure, fertilizers and pesticides. With this, he will be able to do all the cultivation process in the appropriate time, and will guarantee the harvest that will ultimately feed his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and pesticides, so he can perform the cultivation process in time.

loans.name: Nora Esperanza

texts.es:
Nora es una joven de 26 años de edad quien es casada y madre de 3 hijos, agricultora y ama de casa la cual se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de café. A sus 15 años de edad empezó a trabajar en dicha actividad en compañía de sus padres siendo ellos quienes también le heredaran la tierra que hoy en día trabajan junto a su esposo ubicada a una hora de camino desde su casa de habitación involucrándose todos como familia. En su juventud ella no pudo estudiar pues sus padres no contaban con el apoyo económico deseado para que ella pudiera prepararse. 
Los planes a futuro de Nora como una productora de café seguir ampliando sus cultivos de café, tener la suficiente entrada económica y de esa forma evitar que sus hijos pasen por la situación que ella de no poder estudiar y poder prepararse académicamente. Ella solicita apoyo financiero para la compra de insumos agrícolas los cuales serán de mucha ayuda y mucho beneficio para sus cultivos ayudando a estos a mantenerse limpios y seguros de plagas y enfermedades que pudieran ocasionar perdida en el producto. Ella espera ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en KIVA, pues la economía de su hogar depende de la producción de café y en estos momentos ella carece de recursos económicos para poder comprar los insumos.
texts.en:
Nora is a young woman of 26 who is married and the mother of 3 children. She is a farmer and homemaker who dedicates herself to planting and growing coffee. At the age of 15, she started working in this profession alongside her parents. They were also the ones who passed the land along to her which she works today, together with her husband. The land is located an hour's walk from the house where they live, and they are all involved as a family. When she was younger, she was not able to study, because her parents did not have the economic means for her to get an education. 

Nora's plans for the future as a coffee producer are to keep expanding her coffee plantings and to have an adequate economic foundation. In this way, she will avoid putting her children in the situation she faced: not being able to study or get an academic education. She is requesting financial support to buy agricultural supplies, which will be of great help and benefit for her crops, helping keep them clean and safe from pests and diseases which can cause crop losses. She hopes to be supported by many Kiva investors, since her household economy depends on coffee production, and at this time she lacks the economic resources to buy these supplies.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to support and protect her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a single mother of two children. Both her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her old parents). She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

Rosette has a business selling tomatoes and has been in this business for 2 years. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include thieves and transportation. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to start growing tomatoes. 

Rosette has applied for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more boxes of tomatoes and generate additional income from selling charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est majoritairement  composé de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Kalaban Coro chef lieu de commune dans le cercle de Kati (dans la 2ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce, du bois de chauffe, des produits cosmétiques, des habits et des céréales. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Assan (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente du bois de chauffage. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1 chargement de camionnette de bois dans les villages environnants de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché  à une clientèle mixte. Madame Assan espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en: The Danaya Group is predominantly made up of monogamous women, with an average age of 38 and an average of six children each. They all live in the village of Kalaban Coro, the administrative centre of Kati Cercle within the second administrative area of Mali. They all know each other through the bonds of community. The members of the group sell firewood, cosmetic products, clothes and cereals. In order to replenish their cash supplies, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their fourth group loan. Assan, the woman sat to the far left of the photo, has established a solid reputation for selling firewood. She plans on using this loan to purchase one truck-load of firewood from the surrounding villages of Bamako. She will then resell this wood at market to a mixed customer base. With this loan, Assan hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA, which will be reinvested into her business. Through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy her own place to live.

loans.use: to purchase firewood

loans.name: Ruhshona

texts.en: Ruhshona is a kind woman. She is 32 years old. She is married and brings up a child. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Ruhshona has a special education. She began her business with selling food items one year ago. She sells butter, sugar, eggs, pasta, etc. in a food shop. Her shop is located near her house. Her neighbors and friends are her regular customers. She is going to increase working capital but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 USD to buy food items. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
Firuza is an entrepreneur. She is 41 years old. Firuza is married and has two children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. So, Firuza is the main moneymaker of the family. She began her business sewing and selling mattress four years ago. She sells her products in a local market. She develops her business little by little. Firuza is asking for a loan of 7,500 to buy fabrics and cotton for making more mattresses. 

This is her third loan, and she has a good credit history. She will use her profit to send some of her children to university. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and cotton for making more mattresses

loans.name: Tobonby

texts.en: Tobonby is widowed. She is a careful mother of 3 children. Her children study in school and university. She always works hard for their education. She worked in a café as an administrator but her salary was not enough for living. So she began her own business one year ago. She opened the shop where she sells souvenirs. She runs the business in the capital of Tajikistan where there are big business struggles. She is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy souvenirs for increasing working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy souvenirs for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.en: Shoira is a married parent of 3 children. She is a woman who always tries for the well-being of her family. Shoira is a highly educated person. She is a teacher in a local school. She has worked here for many years but her salary is not enough for living. Three months ago, she began her own business selling women's dresses. She sells her goods in a local market on the weekend. She likes her business because she gets additional income. She is going to increase working capital of the new business. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy women's clothes for increasing working capital of the new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for increasing working capital of a new business.

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.en: Maftuna is young woman. She is married and has no children. Three years ago, Maftuna began her business with sewing. She had learned sewing in her parent’s house. After her marriage, her ability became the source of her family income. Maftuna sews national women's dresses. Also she sews dresses for fiancées. She has a good reputation among local people. She is going to develop her business further and maximize profit. Maftuna is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy fabrics for increasing working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia, a 39-year-old married mother of six from Embu, has a business as a mixed crop farmer. She has been in the farming business for the past twenty years. She earns a monthly income of KES 12,000 which she uses to support her family. 

This marks her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya after repaying her previous loan successfully. With the loan, she will be able to purchase farm inputs and animal feeds. Additional income created will allow her to improve the standard of living for her family and pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Anastasia would like to expand her farming land. She hopes to become a prominent farmer in Embu.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and animal feeds.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
To have an additional source of income, Teresa engages in raising hogs within her community. She is 51 years old, and has two adult-age children. She and her husband aim to uplift their status of living in order to give their children a better life. 

She plans to acquire more piglets to raise but she doesn't have enough capital. 

With this regard, Teresa is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. 

She is hoping that she will get her loan request so she can improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a 50-year-old married father of three in Mwingi, earns a living for his family by selling second-hand clothes. Due to limited income to fund his business, he has been unable to expand his business thus the reason he is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to purchase more bales of clothes to expand his customer base which in return will increase his sales and increase his profits too. 

Currently, his business gives him a monthly income of KES 10,000. With the additional income, he will plough back into his business as well as repay his loan. 

In the future, John would like to construct a permanent structure for his business and purchase a piece of land to settle his family.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya lives in Kapan with her husband. 
She is hairdresser with five years of experience working at a local beauty salon. 

Amalya is a very hard-working and talented woman who has a number of loyal clients. She has applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for her work as a hairdresser. 

She  has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing hairdressing services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more good quality fish for her business.

loans.name: Yesu Adom Group

texts.en:
The borrower, Abigail, has been working in retail for the past six years. She has been a member of this group for four years. She is 37 years old, and an experienced entrepreneur. She is also married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Abigail sells used provisions and other foodstuff, and she displays her merchandise at her residence. 

She is requesting a loan from ID Ghana in order to expand her business. She is going to buy canned products, rice, cooking oil, maize, cassava, meat, plantain and fish. 

She started her business with some money received from her husband.

In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land and build on it. She also wants to educate and feed her children. 

She thanks ID Ghana for its support of women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, and for granting them loans without any collateral guarantee.

She, together with Margaret, need a total amount of GHS 5,300 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy canned products, rice, cooking oil, maize, cassava, meat, plantain and fish.

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en: Lorie wishes to finish her child's college education to have a better future. For her, holding a degree at least gives her child the opportunity to get a better job. Lorie is married and engages in a hog raising business. Her husband is a farmer who grows rice in their field. Lorie has been managing her business for 17 years and doesn’t want to simply lose it because of lack of capital. Lorie is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs. The loan will be a big help for her to maintain the business, gain income and sustain her child's study.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of her hogs.

loans.name: Yulduzkhon

texts.en: Yulduzkhon was born in 1984. She lives and works in North Tajikistan. She is a very kind woman. This kind woman is married and has two children. For the well being of her family, she works in a kindergarten, and she has business selling women's underwear and children's clothes. She began her business two years ago. Now, her business is going well. She has a lot of customers, as she works in a kindergarten, and many parents of the children buy from her. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy children's clothes and women's underwear to sell. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes and women's underwear to sell

loans.name: Busara 1 Group

texts.en:
Sauda was born in the early 197'0s and has four children.  Two attend school.  She is a widow.

For the past 20 years, Sauda has managed an establishment that provides food, including breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She also runs a wood and motorbike transport business.  Sauda has helpers and her business opens at 5:00am and closes at midnight, daily.  She earns a very good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this will be Sauda's 12th loan request.  She wants to buy cooking ingredients and restock wood to resell.  Sauda used previous loans to maintain her businesses with stock and she has repaid all previous loans.  

With her profit, Sauda will cover school fees and her family needs. She is doing great and thankful to everyone who has supported her group members. In the coming years, Sauda would like to expand and improve her businesses. 

Sauda will share this loan with her loan group" Busara 1," which includes two members. Members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients and restock woods to resell.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 7 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sébénikoro l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Les membres du groupe font  le petit commerce d’habits industriels d’enfants, des produits cosmétiques et des jus. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mariam (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits d’enfants de tous les âges. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 35 complets d’habits pour enfants de tous les âges en gros au grand marché. La revente s’effectue en détails à Sébénikoro et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mariam espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Danaya Group is made up of married women living with their spouses and children within the framework of a nuclear family. Members have an average age of 41 and an average of seven children each. They all live in Sebenikoro, one of the districts of Bamako. They know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. The members of the group sell industrially-made children's clothing, cosmetic products and fruit juices. In order to replenish their cash supplies, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This will be their third group loan. 

Mariam, the woman standing to the far right of the photograph, has established a solid reputation for selling children's clothing. She plans on using this loan to purchase 35 sets of children's clothes in bulk from the main market. She will then travel around Sebenikoro selling these items of clothing to a predominantly female customer base. With this loan, Mariam hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 CFCA, which will be reinvested into her business and also used to meet her children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He aims to uplift their living status in order to give his children a better life. 

To have an additional source of income, he was engages in raising hogs in his community. He would like to improve this business and make it profitable but he has limited capital. 

For this reason, he wants to avail a loan of PHP 24,000 to buy piglets, hog feed, vitamins and vaccines needed to raise hogs. 

He believes that his loan will help him to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, hog feed, vitamins and vaccines needed for raising hogs

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en: Goharik lives in Kapan with her mother. Goharik is a teacher working at a local school. For 5 years, Gohar has also been involved in a retail business. She sells cosmetics from her house. Due to hard work, she was able to gain loyal customers who prefer to order cosmetics from Goharik only. The reason why she has applied for this loan is that she needs financial support for her retail business. She plans to purchase a new stock of cosmetics for meeting her clients' demand. Goharik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. She will be very thankful to lenders for their support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Meet Rosemary, 35, a fine lady in the streets but an aggressive farmer in the village. She earns a living selling milk, eggs, and tea and through holding a paying job. What she enjoys most is spending time working on her farm. However, like other farmers in her region, her hardwork is constantly taunted by pests and diseases. 

To combat the challenge, she needs to invest in chemicals to control pests and diseases. These inputs are very expensive and eat into the profit margin. But without these inputs, she will be talking losses. With your loan, Rosemary will be able to purchase farm inputs to ensure a quality harvest and avoid heavy losses.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial is 41 years old and married, with two children who attend school.  He and his wife aspire to become financially stable in order to give their children a better future. 

To achieve their goal, Marcial planned to expand his vegetable plantation to ensure high production. 

Having inadequate capital, he wants to avail himself to a loan of PHP15,000.00 to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed to grow vegetables. 

Marcial hopes to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, sheet metal, and adobe in order to build a room.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas works hard to support her family. She is married, and has been selling utensils in Dansoman.

She is requesting a GHS 2,000 loan through ID Ghana to buy utensils to sell to customers.

Dorcas has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Dorcas would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy utensils to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnuts, pepper, and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: José Adrian

texts.es:
José de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, es empleado ya por 4 años también trabaja la agricultura en su tiempo libre viaja todos los días de su casa a la ciudad tarde 30 minutos hacia su trabajo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes etc. desea poder invertir en la agricultura y comprar ganado para aumentar su patrimonio y tener sus hijos apoyarlos y darles el estudio.
texts.en:
José, age 24, studied through the fifth grade.  He is single and lives in his parents’ house.  He has a job, and now for four years he has also worked in farming in his free time.  He travels 30 minutes everyday from his house to the city to go to work.

The loan that he is requesting to to buy soil amendments, pesticides, fertilizers, etc.  He wants to be able to invest in his farming and buy cattle to increase his assets so that he can support his children and provide schooling for them.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, pesticides, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy addition goods to sell.

loans.name: Nemanja

texts.en: Nemanja is 35 and single. Since his mother passed away, he lives only with his father who receives a pension, so in order to earn a living Nemanja works doing blood transfusions. He is trying to work hard in order to provide for this father, and also does most of the cooking and cleaning and taking care of his father’s needs. They are living in a house which is very old and has needed renovations for a very long time. Now, for the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to complete the house renovations. The loan will help them to have better living conditions and standard of living. He is grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To renovate the house

loans.name: Guineales 2 Group

texts.es: Manuela es una persona de 52 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos (es la que aparece de último  de izquierda a derecha de blusa blanca), vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, ella obtiene sus ingresos de la venta de banano,  vende en la comunidad donde vive por allí llegan muchos compradores y tiene mejor opción para vender a un mejor precio, ella organizó un grupo para ayudarse entre ellas, solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos para el mantenimiento de banano, le gusta realizar esta labor porque le genera ingresos, y ella en el futuro quiere sembrar más plantaciones de banano.
texts.en:
Manuela (who appears last from left to right, in a white top) is 52 years old.  She is single and doesn’t have children.  She lives in the town of Nahualá, in the Sololá region.  

She gets her income from selling bananas.  She sells them in the community where she lives.  A lot of buyers come through there and she has the option to sell at a better price.  She organized a group in order to support each other.  She is asking for a loan to buy supplies for the upkeep of the banana trees.  

She likes to do this work because it generates an income for her.  In the future, she wants to plant more banana trees.

loans.use: to provide upkeep to her banana trees

loans.name: Flor De Naranjo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE NARANJO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gladys es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: macramé de mantas, venta de ropa interior, costura de deportivos, servicio de transporte, trenzado de ponchos y mantillas, tejidos, venta de medicamentos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gladys es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías en mantas y ponchos; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio lo aprendió de una de sus amigas, que le enseño la técnica de tejido, posteriormente decide emprender un negocio independiente con el cual genera recursos económicos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Flor de Narajo” (Orange Blossom) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Gladys serves as the treasurer. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as producing macramé blankets, selling undergarments, making sportswear, providing transportation services, knitting ponchos and shawls, weaving, and selling medicines.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Sra. Gladys. She says that this is her second loan cycle since joining Pro Mujer after receiving an invitation from a friend who is also a member of the organization. Gladys currently has a handicraft business in which she produces blankets and ponchos. She is knowledgeable about this business because she learned the trade from one of her friends who taught her the art of knitting. Later on, she decided to establish her own independent business so that she could generate an income.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool in bulk. She acquires her supplies from the distribution stores in the city of El Alto and then uses them to produce what she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner allows her to generate income for sustaining her family. Gladys is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Gladys says that she enjoys the health seminars that are offered by the organization.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландом замужем, ей 33 года. Она родила и воспитывает троих детей. Ее муж работает на стройке. А Гуландом во дворе дома занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Она этой деятельностью уже занимается 10 лет. Гуландом и ее семья хотя и бедно, но зато счастливо живут в селе района Хамадони. Гуландом счастлива, потому что у нее понимающий муж, милые и здоровые дети. К тому же у нее есть деятельность, которая приносит ей не только доход, но и удовольствие. Гуландом хочет увеличить поголовье скота в своем скотном дворе. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит, чтобы она смогла купить телят. Этот кредит ей очень нужен.
texts.en: Gulandom is 33 and married with three children. Her husband works in construction, and she works in animal husbandry out of her home, an occupation she has had for 10 years. Gulandom and her family might be poor, but they live happily in a village in the Hamadoni region. She is happy because she has an understanding husband and sweet and healthy children, as well as an occupation that brings her not only income, but also pleasure. Gulandom wants to increase the number of livestock she has on her property. For this reason she is requesting a loan so that she can buy calves. She needs this loan very much.

loans.use: to buy calves to increase the amount of livestock she has

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian de 38 años de edad desde hace muchos años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maiz y hortalizas con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos. El quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografia pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en: Adrian is 38 years old and has been a farmer for many years.  This is his main source of income and he raises corn and vegetables and uses his earnings to pay his family expenses.  He lives in a home of his own with his wife and children.  He wants to buy the supplies he needs such as fertilizers, seeds, and make improvements to the land where he plants his crops, as shown in the photograph, but given that he doesn’t have the necessary resources, he is asking for a loan since this is the only way he can continue his farming.  As with other country folk, he trusts in farming because he has no other source of income and he wants to succeed in doing the best he can with his crops.  He expects to have a good harvest that will allow him to continue bringing home the daily bread and pay off this loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Rade

texts.en:
Rade is 62 years old and resides in a village in a minority community in Kosovo.  He lives with his wife and son, who is divorced.  His unemployed son has two children ages three and seven, who do not live with him at this time. 

Rade receives a pension and his wife works as a nurse.  Between his pension and wife’s salary, they are barely to pay their daily living expenses.

Rade requests a loan to replace their very old and broken furniture in their house.

The loan will help improve their environment and living conditions, booost their health and help them get a better night's sleep. 

Rade is hoping his son will find a job and be able to keep closer contact with his children and family. 

Rade promises to repay the loan on time, and he thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy new home furniture.

loans.name: Komborero

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 31-year-old Komborero from Masvingo. He is married with two children, and he also cares for one other dependent. 

Komborero runs a retail business selling cellphone recharge cards. The business has been in operation for five years. He says the main challenges he faced are shortages of recharge cards, and high levels of competition. 

Komborero has requested a loan of $300 to purchase recharge cards for wholesale. 

He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him an increase in disposable income, hence improving the family's welfare. 

In the future, Komborero plans to be a wholesale distributor of recharge cards.

loans.use: to purchase cellphone recharge cards for wholesale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with five children. Two of the children are attending school. 

She has a flea market business in Masvingo in Zimbabwe. She has been running this business for five years, and sells clothes. She also earns other income from rentals of her house. She says that the main challenge to her business is that of debtors failing to pay, resulting in late restocking.

Josephine requested this loan of $500 through MicroKing to purchase clothes to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve family welfare.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Sladjana

texts.en:
Sladana is 49 years old, married, and the mother of two boys and one girl. She works as a nurse, and her husband is unemployed, so she is the main source of income for her family. She considers herself lucky, though, as unemployment is very high in the area that they are living in, and her job is decent. 

The house that they live in is very old and in urgent need of renovation and repair. The façade on the outside of the house is not complete, and therefore, they do not have sufficient insulation or living conditions. The loan for these repairs will not only improve their standard of living and provide a healthy and comfortable atmosphere, it will also decrease their expenses on utilities. 

She says that without this loan it will be impossible for her to save money for her children’s education due to the high costs from lack of a façade. Her goal is to give her children a better education and improve their family life. She wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To renovate the facade of the house for improving her family's living conditions

loans.name: Flora Zoila

texts.es:
Flora de 67 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora quien junto a su esposo trabajan la tierra para cultivar el maíz, sus hijas ya están casadas y formaron su propia familia, ella solamente estudio hasta el tercer grado de educación primaria. 

Flora junto a su esposo ya tiene varios años de estar en el cultivo de granos básicos,  ya que desde que su papá cultivaba,  ella le ayudaba en la siembra y la recolección de la cosecha. 

El préstamo será utilizado primeramente en el pago de mano de obra, para que le ayuden a ella y a su esposo en la limpieza de la tierra para comenzar a prepararla para la cosecha y también en la compra de alambre para cercar el terreno y luego la compra de la semilla para la siembra, y los fertilizantes a utilizar.


A futuro la señora quiere que a ella y a su esposo no les falte el sustento diario, que tengan el maíz que es lo principal para mantenerse y que les genere un poco de ganancia en la venta y de esta forma poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Flora, age 67, is a tenacious woman.  She and her husband work the land together in order to grow corn.  Her daughters are married and have their own families.  She only went to school through the third grade.

Flora and her husband have been growing basic grains for several years.  When her father cultivated the land, she helped him plant and gather the harvest.

The loan will be primarily used to pay for labor to help her and her husband clear the land in order to start preparing it for the harvest.  She will also buy wire to fence the land.  Then she will buy seeds for planting and the fertilizers they will use.

In the future she wants for her and her husband to not go without their daily bread.  She wants them to have corn, which is their main thing for sustaining themselves.  She wants to generate a little bit earnings when sold.  This way she will be able to continue working.

loans.use: to pay for labor, seeds, fertilizer, and wire for a fence.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and sells palm oil in Dansoman. 

She is requesting a GHS 1500 loan through ID-Ghana to buy three big gallons to resell to customers.  Lydia has been in business for 15 years. 

In the future, Lydia plans to save enough money to build a depot to supply to retailers.

loans.use: to buy three big gallons to resell to customers.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is 51 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Parveen’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Parveen has applied for a loan of 45,000 Pakistani rupees for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Parveen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez has successfully built her business selling vegetables with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she purchased different vegetables to inflate her sales. By this time she has become famous in her locality for providing fresh vegetables. 

To meet the increasing demands of her customers, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). In this way she will be able to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and ginger. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and ginger.

loans.name: Busara Group

texts.en:
Suzana, who is in her early 40s, is married with two kids who are still at school.  She has been working on two projects; she has a soft drink shop as well as keeping and selling broilers for four years. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Suzana's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock for the soft drink shop and she also started the chicken business. She has repaid all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses.  She is happy and appreciates Kiva's support of their group.  She will use this loan to buy chicken feeds to make her chicken broilers healthy and a good weight.  She dreams of making her shop big.

Suzana will share this loan with her loan group "Busara" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed to help make her chicken broilers healthy and a good weight.

loans.name: Mary Isabel

texts.es: La señora Mary tiene 30 años,  ella se dedica a la confección  de ropa vestidos para niñas, ella entrega  sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de La Paz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Mary  va a usar este préstamo para compra de material de construcción para refacción de vivienda ya que desea brindar mayor comodidad a su familia,  la señora Mary enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia  ya que en el mercado hay mucha gente que entrega y confecciona vestidos,  se siente feliz ya agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para tener una mayor comodidad como también  crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Mary is 30 years old, and she works making clothing for girls. She sells her products in different fairs around the city of La Paz. This loan is her first sequence from the institution. She is going to use the loan to buy construction material for household repairs because she desires to afford her family greater comfort. Mary confronts challenges in her business like the competition because in the market there are many people who make and sell clothes. She feels happy and appreciative for the opportunity afforded to her by having a more comfortable life and also growing in her work and increasing her income and there her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella  posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su trabajo responsable y honesta, Maria esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y así el  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children.  She has a tailor workshop in her home, where she makes different types of clothing and has gotten many customers lately because she is honest, responsible, does excellent work, and sells it at very affordable prices.  Maria is asking for this loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, and everything related to sewing so that she can continue satisfying her customer needs and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old and from Nyahururu. He is married to Lucy, and they are blessed with six children, aged 19, 17, 14, 12, 10 and 6 years old.

He has been running his motorcycle repair business for the last five years, and to enable him to buy more spare parts to sell to his customers, he has applied for his fourth loan of 70,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is 30,000 KES, and his plan is to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children, pay his loan to VisionFund Kenya and buy more spare parts to sell to his customers.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycles to sell to his customers

loans.name: Claudia Ester

texts.es:
Claudia de 43 años de edad, es una bachiller,  es casada;  el esposo se dedica al comercio ya que él tenía una tienda, ellos han procreado 4 hijos en esta relación,  uno de ellos están con ella y los demás ya están en hogares apartes y trabajando.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar gaseosas, churros, dulces y galletas, aceite, arroz, frijoles y azucarar también comprara huevos son cosas que a diario se venden porque la gente lo consume, esto le va a ayudar mucho ya que le hace falta tener la tienda que ellos habían quitado por problemas de otras personas; poco a poco podrá surtirla de los productos que la gente más busca.

El sueño de Claudia  es poder tener nuevamente la tienda, ya que antes ella su hijo y el esposo eran muy felices con este ingreso,  ellos podran salir adelante darle a su hijo los estudios que él necesita,  ya que es la única herencia que le dejaran.
texts.en:
Claudia, who is 43 years old, is a high school graduate and is married. Her husband works in business, as he had a shop. They have 4 children from their marriage. One of them lives with them and the others live away from home and are working.

The loan Claudia is asking for is to buy fizzy drinks, doughnuts, sweets and biscuits, oil, rice, beans and sugar and also eggs, which are all things that are sold every day because people use them. This will help her a great deal since she needs to have the shop which they had left because of problems with other people. She will be able to gradually stock it with the kind of things that people need most often.

Claudia's dream is to be able to have the shop again, because previously she and her husband and son were very happy with this income. They will be able to get on in life and give their son the education he needs, as this is the only thing they will be able to pass on to him.

loans.use: to buy fizzy drinks, doughnuts, sweets and biscuits, oil, rice, beans and sugar and also eggs.

loans.name: Sladana

texts.en:
Sladana wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which she used to buy construction materials to finish the toilet and other rooms. Even with both of their salaries, their house is still in need of a facade, as they started it, but have not been able to save the money to finish it. 

Being able to complete this work is very important to her family’s health; it will help decrease expenses and will improve the general conditions of their home. In the winter, they lose much heat because of this. Also, in wet weather, it leaves the walls wet and moldy, causing damage that will need to be repaired. 

Sladana is now requesting a second loan to pay for the materials and the labor to finish this facade. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for both loans.

loans.use: To add facade to her house

loans.name: Jeton

texts.en:
Jeton wants to thank all of the lenders for the loan, which he has used buy a milk cow and to build a new stable in hopes of increasing the dairy production and the earnings from selling dairy products to the locals. The loan has helped him to reduce the family’s cost of living by being able to use the products for personal consumption, as well as increase the family’s monthly income. 

Now he is asking for a second loan so that he can install a water system in the stable and purchase guano. 

Until now, Jeton has had to bring water inside the stable for his cow, which took a lot of time and was often a difficult and tiring process. By having a water system in the stable, he will be able to save a lot of time and energy and therefore be able to focus on the actual milking and selling of the products, as well as continue to focus on selling the coal in his community for heating. 

With the added time he will save, Jeton has been hoping to start planting corn and wheat to sell as well, increasing his income even more. 

His goal is to give his children a better education. He wants to thank all of the lenders again.

loans.use: To install a water system for the stable and to purchase guano

loans.name: Cesar Vallejo De V.e.s Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6  personas emprendedoras   y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “CESAR VALLEJO DE V.E.S”.  Cecilia de 52 años de edad  soltera y sin hijos, ella se dedica hace 3 años  a la venta de comida tanto en el día como en la noche.  Cecilia  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender su comida y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en ampliar su local comprar (sillas,mesas,cubiertos,platos etc)   y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  Cecilia    y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva,  Cecilia  es la primera de la mano derecha se le distingue  con una bolsa de color blanco que lleva sobre la mano, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas
texts.en:
The members of the Communal Bank “Cesar Vallejo de V.E.S.” are a group that consists of six enterprising individuals who have great creativity with their businesses.

Cecilia is 52 years old, single, and has no children. For the past three years, she has been selling food during the day as well as at night. Cecilia says that she has gained the loyalty of her customers and is able to generate income to cover her household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own location where she can sells food and generate more earnings. The loan she is receiving will be invested in the expansion of her stall (tables, chairs, cutlery, plates, etc.) so that she can get ahead.

Cecilia and all of the other members are grateful to Kiva. In the photo, Cecilia is the first person on the right who is holding a white bag in her hand. The group commits to accomplishing all of their proposed goals.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, cutlery, plates, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Hortensia

texts.es: Maria  de 41 años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; ella necesita invertir por eso le solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, etc. y mejorar el terreno para la siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía. Maria tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Maria is 41 years old and lives in his own home along with his life companion and his children. She cultivates corn and beans. Maria has been farming for several years and has gained a great deal of experience, which has helped her to obtain better harvests. Whatever she produces is sold in the surrounding neighborhoods of her community. Maria has many customers who prefer the quality of her products, the good prices, but most of all, the good service she provides.

Maria needs to invest, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, and other supplies so that she can improve the land for planting, which is shown in the photograph. She has good payment references from her acquaintances. Maria is very responsible and is confident that she can repay this debt within the designated period. At the same time, she believes that she can achieve financial security for her household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina es una persona de 25 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz La Laguna, departamento de Sololá, tiene tres hijos: el primero es de 4 años de edad estudia en párvulos, el segundo es de 3 años de edad y el último es de 1 año de edad, el segundo y el último todavía no asisten a la escuela, se dedica a la compra y venta de güipiles y cortes típicos, ya que es un negocio que deja buena ganancia porque todas mujeres del municipio visten de estos trajes y casi siempre tiene demanda, Cristina solicita un crédito por un monto de Q.5,000.00 para invertir en la compra y venta de maíz, sería su otra actividad que le genera ingresos,  ella aprendió de su mamá desde pequeña a negociar, Cristina en el futuro quiere tener un local en el mercado del municipio para atender mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cristina is 25 years old and lives in the town of Santa Cruz La Laguna, in the department of Sololá. She has three children: the oldest is 4 years old and goes to nursery school. The second child is 3 years old and the youngest is 1 year old. The two younger ones don't go to school yet.

Cristina makes a living buying and selling "güipiles" [traditional garments hand-embroidered by women in Guatemala] and regional costumes. This is a business which gives a good profit, because all of the town's women dress in this type of clothing and there is almost always a demand for it.

Cristina is asking for a loan of 5,000 GTQ to invest in buying and selling corn. This is her other work which generates income for her. When she was little she learnt from her mum how to do business.

In future Cristina wants to have a stall in the town's market so she can serve her customers better.

loans.use: to buy and sell corn.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, solo estudio segundo grado, está casado la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ha procreado 3 hijos en este matrimonio.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad,  este trabajo se lo enseño el papá ya que él quería que  aprendiera el oficio,  para que en un futuro le sirviera y siempre le inculco en   el buen camino y le enseño este oficio y se los  enseño para  que en un futuro se pudieran defender, este trabajo le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos  y él viaja a pie. También se dedica a la ganadería ya que compra vacas para vender la leche y el queso fresco.  

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar una vaca,  que le venden es una vaca lechera, él quiere aprovechar que se la venden más cómoda y es una vaca muy conocida que es buena para la leche, esto le ayudara mucho ya que es así la única forma con los créditos de hacerse de sus animales esto le va generar muchos ingresos y ya no será solo la agricultura sino que también lo de la leche. 
Los sueños que tiene es que siempre poder  cultivar  la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa y hacerse de sus animales que le generen ingreso y tener solo vacas lecheras.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and only studied until Grade 2. He is married and his wife does the housework. They have 3 children from this relationship. José has been farming since he was 15. His father taught him how as he wanted him to learn as in the future it would be useful. His father taught him to stay on the right path and how to take care of himself.

His plot is located 15 minutes away from his house and he walks there. He also raises cattle as he bought cows to sell milk and fresh cheese. The loan José is requesting is to buy a milk cow. He wants to take advantage of this as it is convenient and he knows the cow and knows that it is a good milk producer. This will help him a lot as he can only obtain his animals through the loans. The cow will generate a lot of income as he doesn't only have farming but also milk. His dream is that he can always work the earth, support his household and have his animals generate income. He wants to have all milk cows.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Cathrine from Harare. She is married with two children, both attending school. 

Cathrine runs a retail business selling clothes. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenges faced are unfair pricing of tariffs, such as excise duties at the ports of entry. 

Cathrine has requested a loan of $300 to buy clothes for resale and boost her business. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase profits and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, Cathrine plans to own a flourishing self-sustaining boutique.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothes for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 50-year-old woman. She has a retail shop that sells cereals like groundnuts, maize, and millet in the market stall. 

Margret started the business so as to earn a living. She wishes to have a big store, despite being challenged by competition. 

Margret is a hardworking woman who needs a loan to buy maize, groundnuts, and millet to sell.
