loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel, tiene la edad  de 73 años, está casado, vive con su esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de labores culturales para evitar la erosión del suelo principalmente por la lluvia y de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo de la variedad inverníz para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Daniel is 73 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, who is his highest priority. With his loan he plans to buy fertilizers and fungicides, and to pay labor for farming tasks so he can prevent soil erosion caused by rain, and to maintain his coffee crop. He will also buy some seedling plants of the inverníz [winter] variety so he can replant when the rains start. He has the goal of increasing the density of plants and also of taking advantage of the good soil fertility and climatic and other conditions that favor coffee cultivation. With these improvements to his crop, he expects to earn a bit more income and thereby improve conditions for his family; also invest a little more in cultivation; and also to achieve some goals. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn’t had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him the loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Nila Ana

texts.es: La señora Nila tiene 56  años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Plan 3000 de la ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Nila va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces, galletas y variedad de refrescos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su tienda ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, la señora Nila enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas de barrio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén ya que este es uno deseos, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Nila is 56 years old. She makes a living by selling articles of basic need in her neighborhood store located in her home, which is in the Plan 3000 area of the city of Santa Cruz.

This is her first loan with the institution. Nila is going to use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her business like groceries, sweets, cookies and a variety of drinks. She is asking for this loan because she needs to stock her store since there is a lot of demand at this time of year.

Nila faces challenges in her business such as competition, as there are a lot of neighborhood stores in the area. She is going to use her profits to keep buying merchandise and thus increase her capital in order to have a warehouse; this is something she wants. She feels happy and grateful for this opportunity you are giving her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa is a 41-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a small business selling pork buns in her community and has been doing this for more than five years. Epenesa has requested a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, oil, a gas oven, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Epenesa will plan to extend her business for her family earning.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, oil, a gas oven, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Tapaau

texts.en: Tapaau is a 31-year-old single woman who has three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, banana, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Tapaau has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings, and an axe. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Tapaau hopes to expand her business and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings, and an axe

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 40 años pero tiene la vitalidad de un joven de 20 años, ya que el trabajo es su herramienta para vivir lleno de vitalidad, la vivienda donde habita Marco se encuentra en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad en la cual encontramos muchos atractivos turísticos y podemos apreciar la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, paprika, esparrago, entre otros. Marco una razón muy importante para luchar cada día y esa es su familia, el vive al lado de su esposa y de sus hijos a quienes ama muchísimo y a pesar de las adversidades que la vida le ha presentado sigue unido más que nunca a su familia. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Marco solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Medicina Humana.

Día a día Marco lucha para sacar a su familia adelante y lo hace con su pequeño y humilde negocio e lavado de autos, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes de manera diaria; él cree que está saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y porque su familia es el motor y la mejor motivación de lucha.

Marco está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le están brindando el podrá utiles escolares para sus pequeños hijos y de esta manera sus hijos puedan tener los materiales necesarios para estudiar sin inconvenientes y seguir esforzándose para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Ofrecerles  una buena educación a sus hijos y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Marco is a very hardworking man. He is 40 but has the vitality of a young person of 20, since his work is his tool to live full of vitality. The home where Marco lives is found in the city of Ica, a city where we find many tourist attractions and can appreciate the agriculture, especially cotton, paprika, asparagus, among others.

One very important reason Marco fights every day is his family. He lives along with his wife and his children, whom he loves very much. Despite the adversities which have been presented to him, he stays united more than ever with his family. Given his few economic resources, Marco could only study until fifth grade of secondary school, but he would have liked to study the career of Human Medicine.

Day by day, Marco fights to get his family ahead and he does it with his small and humble business of car washing. He works around 10 hours daily and he can attend to up to 10 customers a day. He believes that he is getting ahead in his business because he is friendly with the customers and because his family is the driving force and the best motivation for fighting.

Marco is very thankful for the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they are providing him he will be able to buy school supplies for his small children. In this manner, his children can have the necessary materials to study without inconvenience. He can continue pushing himself to make his great dream a reality: "Offer a good education to his children and have his own house."

loans.use: to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose vive en el distrito de Santiago, tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, e spor ello que trabaja como operario en una empresa agroexportadora, con lo cual puee tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y poder solventar los gastos de su hogar ya que es padre de 2 hijos de 8 y 2 años.

Jose esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar utiles escolares para sus hijos, asimismo utilizar una pequeña parte del dinero para realizar arreglos en el techo de su vivienda, de est amanera sus hijos podrán ir a la escuela con los materiales necesarios, asimismo mejorar su vivienda y con ello la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose lives in the Santiago District.  He has a great desire to get ahead, which is why he works at an agricultural exporting company.  Through his work he earns the income he needs to get ahead and to meet his household expenses.  He is the father of two children, who are 8 and 2-years old respectively. 

Jose is grateful for the Kiva lenders, as thanks to their help he will be able to purchase school supplies for his children as well as use a small part of the money to make some repairs to his house's roof.  This way, his children will be able to go to school with the materials they need and he will be able to improve his house and thereby his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and to fix his home's roof.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Robina is a 51-year-old, married woman; she has had a business selling milk for the past 15 years. She has three cows for milk, and she sells it to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to support her with a decent life. She has six children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses of life. She is happily running her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase one more cow. She expects boost in her earnings through her larger sales.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband helps her by purchasing goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health care. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, grains, biscuits, and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, grains, biscuits, and beverages.

loans.name: Galutoto`

texts.en: Galutoto is a 38-year-old, married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas and more to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years. Galutoto has requested a loan to buy cement, barbed wired, spades, two cows etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2000. With her profits, Galutoto hopes to extend her house and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy cement, barbed wire, two cows, spades, etc.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 29-year-old single, man from Jenin city. He lives with his family in a very simple house. He works in a restaurant, for very long hours, so he can help his family with part of their expenses. Mahmoud is a student in a local university where he studies Business Administration. He would like to finish his studies and take the BA degree so he can find a better job in the future.  Mahmoud took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking his loan, Mahmoud will be able to write his homework and reports easily.  Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Jempiring Group

texts.en:
Ni Wayan and all member of Jempiring group make their payment to MUK and they agree to borrow an increased loan amount. They expect MUK will continue to support them in terms of capital and training.

Accompanied by her husband, Ni Wayan runs a pig bussines. Her husband is very thorough at keeping the pigs. She also has another side job as a farmer. The profits from the pig business are set aside to purchase seeds for their garden and also for savings.

Ni Wayan and the Jempiring group will receive their third loan with the same members. Each member will receive 2.500.000 IDR. They will use their loans to improve the pig businesses, purchase superior piglets, local piglets and feed. Ni Wayan use her loan to purchase superior feed only, because she still has pigs and sows remaining in her cage. 

Ni Wayan lives with her husband and a toddler. She expects an increasing in her standard of living from pursuing this pig business. 

Two members were unable to attend the meeting because they had a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es: José tiene 62 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 13 y 7 años de edad. José es un hombre emprendedor quien se gana la vida mediante la venta de productos de plástico como: platos, vasos, tazas, recipientes, etc. De esta forma es como mantiene la economía de su hogar y lleva el sustento a sus hijos. Con el fin de mantener activo su negocio solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de plástico como: platos, tazas, vasos, recipientes y de más productos de cocina que los clientes prefieren.
texts.en: José is 62 years old and lives in his own house with his two children aged 7 and 13. José  is an enterprising man who makes his living selling plastic items like plates, glasses, cups, bowls, etc. By doing this he maintains the household economy and supports his children. With the goal of continuing to be active in his business he has requested this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a large quantity of plastic items like plates, cups, glasses, bowls  and other kitchen items that his customers want.

loans.use: to buy plastic products like plates, cups, glasses, bowls,etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is a married woman with seven school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, Mupa has operated a kiosk shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with eight children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over five years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the loan, Josephine wants to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 55-year-old mother who was blessed with four children. They are currently residing in a rural community and they earn their living through farming. 

To earn additional income, Teresita engages in raising pigs within the local community. She would like to strengthen this business but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000.00 to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise. Being a hard-working mother, she believes that she will improve the business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre muy preparado y capacitado en el área de la seguridad industrial y salud ocupacional, pues es graduado como técnico en seguridad industrial.
Ha pasado por diferentes entidades lo que le ha permitido adquirir una amplia experiencia en este campo, entre ella cabe destacar su paso por la Defensa Civil, el entrenamiento recibido allí ha sido fundamental para su ejercicio profesional pues le permitió desempeñarse como instructor.
Desde hace más de un año decidió iniciar su negocio de contratación de servicio de asesoría en seguridad industrial y salud ocupacional con instituciones educativas, empresas y fábricas, además se dedica a la comercialización de implementos para la seguridad.
En estos momentos solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de elementos como extintores, botiquines de primeros auxilios, señalizaciones, salvavidas, entre otros; así podrá ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
Su mayor sueño es poder darles una excelente calidad de vida a su esposa y su primer hijo que viene en camino.
texts.en:
Juan is a very prepared and trained man in the area of industrial safety and occupational health. He graduated with a technical degree in industrial security.

He gone through different entities which have allowed him to acquire an ample experience in this field, among them his noteworthy passing through Civil Defense. The training received there has been fundamental for his professional exercise. It allowed him to serve as an instructor. Since more than a year ago, he decided to start his business providing advisory services for industrial safety and occupational health with educational institutions, businesses and factories. Additionally, he makes a living selling safety implements. 

In these times, he is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of elements like fire extinguishers, first aid kits, signs, life vests, among others. Therefore he will be able to increase the variety of products that the offers to his clients and increase his income.

His greatest dream is to be able to give an excellent quality of life to his wife and his first son, who is on the way.

loans.use: to buy safety implements for reselling: (first aid kits, jackets, fire extinguishers, among others.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats in order to increase his business.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as coffee, sugar, salt, milk, gards, oils and bread. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300.  She is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, salt, milk, gards, oils and bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his college tuition fees and other college expenses.

loans.name: Sipina

texts.en:
Sipina is 25 years old, and is married with three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas etc to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years.

Sipina has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and an axe. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services. With her profits,Sipina will save for unexpected emergencies and support her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and an axe for her farming activities.

loans.name: Olga Visitación

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Olga; La socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de bisuteria,la socia trabaja a pedido para sus distintos clientes que le solicitan, la socia elabora diferentes accesorios como artes, collares entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alambres, piedras entre otros para elaborar sus accesorios.

La socia siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member is Olga. The member continues dedicating herself to the business of jewelry. The member works for orders by different clients who order from her. The member makes different accessories like art, among them necklaces. The member is a very responsible and earnest woman, thus being the manner in how the member gets her family ahead.

The member is applying for the loan to buy wire, stones among others to make her accessories. The member feels thankful for the loan granted and she is committed to fulfilling her established repayments.

loans.use: to buy wire, stones among others to make her accessories.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.en:
Silvestre is married with five children. He is 56 years old and lives in Tangub, Philippines.

Silvestre is a farmer and a coconut climber. He has been earning a living through these activities for thirty years. He has requested a loan to buy additional gallons for his vinegar retail business.
 
Silvestre has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Silvestre hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy additional gallons for his vinegar retail business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Meet Benson! He comes from Kisii, Kenya. For nine years, he has been selling agricultural produce from his farm to take care of his wife and three children. 

The first thing you will notice when you visit Benson is how tidy his land is. His land is located uphill, and miles away from the river. Weeding is what Benson enjoys the most. Watering is what he finds most strenuous.
 
Today, Benson comes before you seeking a loan to buy a water tank. This will eliminate the task of going miles to fetch water for his plants and household. The tank will also provide water for his farm animals. Through your loan, Benson will save a lot of time spent by his family going to fetch water and dedicate it to other tasks such as homework, cooking, leisure etc. Through your loan, Benson's life will be much easier.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank to provide water for his plants, farm animals, and household.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha 46 years old and is married with one child. She lives in Caniangan, Tangub city.

To earn a living, Editha has been running a sari-sari business (general store) for one year. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 from this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods and soft drinks.

Editha has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Editha hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods and soft drinks.

loans.name: Lagrimas Fe

texts.en: Lagrimas Fe is married with three children. She is 60 years old and lives in Barangay Silanga, Tangub City. To earn a living, Lagrimas Fe has a sidecar motorcycle rental business. She has had this business for a year. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 6,000.  Lagrimas Fe has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Lagrimas Fe hopes to earn more income in order to provide for their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sidecar for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jerusa

texts.en:
Meet Jerusa! For the past nine years, this mother of four children has been keeping dairy animals. She earns a living by selling milk to the locals. When asked what she finds most enjoyable, she answered, "Selling Milk!”. 

Jerusa has formed a group with other local women to empower each other. Their group has joined a microfinance organization called Juhudi Kilimo which was formed to transform smallholder rural farmers. Through Juhudi, Jerusa is seeking a loan from Kiva to help improve her children's livelihood.

With the loan, Jerusa will buy a dairy cow and increase milk production in her farm. She will sell the milk to schools nearby to repay the loan and retain some for her family's consumption.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Trinidad  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Trinidad está formado por 8 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia de Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es considerado como el mirador de la ciudad de Cuenca ya que desde allí se puede observar la mayor parte de la ciudad, su gente se dedica al comercio, también a la cría de animales y a la agricultura. Las socias  trabajan día a día en el campo o en diferentes actividades para sacar en adelante a sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo la Señora. María, tiene 34 años de edad, es divorciada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 17, 16, 7 y 5 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija le ayuda en las tareas del hogar, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña María se dedica a la limpieza de zapatos, actividad que la realiza desde hace 5 años, este trabajo le ayuda a mejorar la estabilidad de su hogar, en casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cerdos, también a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para su casa y a veces vende. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para animales. Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Trinidad” consists of eight women who live in the surrounding neighborhoods of Turi Parish in the city of Cuenca. This parish is considered to be the vantage point of the city of Cuenca since one can see most of the city from that area. The people engage in trade, but they also spend time farming and raising animals. The members of this group work each day either in the fields or at different business activities so that their family can move forward.

One of the group members is Sra. María. She is 34 years old, divorced, and has four children (ages 17, 15, 7, and 5). Her oldest child, a son, works and helps out financially. The second child, a daughter, helps with the household chores. The youngest two children attend an elementary school in town. She owns the house in which she lives.

Doña María cleans shoes, a business activity that she has been doing for five years. This type of work has helped to provide better stability for her household. At home she raises chickens and pigs. She also grows crops and whatever she harvests is used at home, but sometimes she sells her output. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and feed for her animals. Her dream is to see her children become professionals.

The smaller photo is of a member who was not able to be present at the time the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: José Efraín

texts.es:
José de 74 años de edad, esta casado, y tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos estan ya casados de él depende solo su esposa. José estudio hasta primer grado no pudo continuar sus estudios debido a la pobreza en que vivian sus padres, José y su esposa tiene una tienda en la cual se dedican a vender.
 
José se dedica tambien a panificador y a la agricultura desde hace 20 años, para llegar a su trabajo José camina 10 minutos y trabaja en el horario de 6:00 AM a 12:00 del mediodia todos los dias de la semana. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para compra de 2 animales y para  ampliar un poco mas la tienda con la compra de productos de la canasta básica, de lo que espera ahorrar para mejorar la calidad de vida. 

José sueña con tener de su tienda una mejor rentabilidad y una mejor cosecha de la agricultura.
texts.en:
José, 74, is married and has four children who are all already married. Only his wife depends on him. José studied through first grade. He could not continue his studies due to the poverty in which his parents lived. José and his wife have a store from which they make a living doing sales. 
 
José has also worked as a baker and a farmer for the last 20 years. José walks for 10 minutes to get to work, and then works from 6:00 AM to 12:00 noon every day of the week.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy two animals, and to expand the business a bit more by buying staple goods. He hopes to save money with this loan, in order to improve his quality of life. 

José dreams of making better profits off his store and a better agricultural harvest.

loans.use: to buy two cows, and to expand the store a little more with the purchase of staple goods

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en: Nduku is a married woman, who has four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Nduku operates a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition in her business from other vegetable operators. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia lives in Stepanavan, Armenia with her two daughters. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. 

Six months ago, Emilia started a retail business to tackle the financial hardship that she was facing. Her business entails selling clothing and dressmaking supplies. The business provides her with income to sustain her family.

Emilia would like to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to help her purchase new clothing stock that will allow her to meet her clients' demands. Emilia has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new clothing stock

loans.name: Rani

texts.en: Rani is a 43-year-old vigorous, married lady. She has four children. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons. It will allow her to stitch more dresses on time to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors with packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Sedana Ayu Group

texts.en:
One month ago, Ni Nengah, the head of the Sedana Ayu Group, informed the six members to prepare for repayment of their 15.000.000 IDR loan. 

Ni Nengah succeeded in selling two pigs for a price of 2.500.000 IDR, and the remaining one pig is to be sold in a few weeks. With the advantage of 750.000 IDR, she is very grateful to the acquisition and will use the profits to purchase a superior sow.

This is the fourth loan for the Sedana Ayu Group. After they make the repayment, the group hope to increase the loan size. They still need financial support for their businesses, until they are able to continue their businesses with their own capital. With every sale of pork, they save the profits to use as venture capital. After evaluation by MUK’s staff, the group received a higher loan size to increase their businesses. 

Ni Nengah will use her loan portion to purchase local piglets. She plans to sell the piglets. Pig bolsters require easier care than superior pigs and faster sales. She hopes her new plan can be more successful.

loans.use: to purchase local piglets.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es estudiante del cuarto año en la carrera de Derecho, vive con sus padres, donde su meta futura es poder  montar su propio Estudio Jurídico y recibir las especializaciones necesarias como para llegar a ser juez o fiscal.
Él está luchando por ser un profesional exitoso y que está luchando por ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar las cuotas de su universidad, como así también poder cubrir sus gastos de manutención.
texts.en:
Juan is a fourth-year student who is obtaining a law degree. He lives with his parents. His future goal is to establish his own law practice and develop the necessary skills to become a judge or a prosecutor.

Juan is striving to become someone in life who is a successful professional. He is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the payment of his university installments, as well as his living expenses.

loans.use: to pay his university installments and living expenses.

loans.name: Chocolatito Group

texts.es: El grupo lo integran tres socios exitosos, coordinado por la señora Candida de 42 años de edad, acompañada y de tres hijos, pero solamente uno depende de ella de la edad de 17 años, tiene su propio comedor en su domicilio y tiene dos trabadoras que le ayudan a elaborar la comida, el crédito lo invertirá en alimentos como es arroz, aceite, frijoles, carne de res, carne de cerdo, carne de pollo, plátano verde, plátano maduro, pastas, tomate, lechuga, zanahoria, y más. Otra socia es el señor Marlon de 46 años que comercializa lácteos en su domicilio y la señora Verónica de 35 años quien ofrece ropa nueva y cosméticos en su domicilio y por encargo.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three successful associates, and is coordinated by Candida, who is 42 years old. She is in a relationship and has three children, but only the seventeen-year-old one depends on her. 

She has her own dining room in her home, and she has two workers who help her make the food. She will invest the loan in food items such as rice, oil, beans, beef, pork, chicken, green plantains, sweet plantains, pasta, tomatoes, lettuce, carrots, and more. 

The other associates are Marlón, age 46, who sells dairy products in his home, and Verónica, 35, who offers new clothes and cosmetics from her home or delivered.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, beef, chicken, pasta, tomatoes, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 42 years old, and married with four children. Three of her children go to school, while her youngest child is still an infant. The couple has been working hard to sustain their daily needs and support the children’s education. Susana would like to ask for financial assistance amounting to PHP 10,000 that will be used to purchase various kinds of merchandise, raw meat, vegetables, and fruits to sell. She hopes to obtain this amount of loan in order to improve her sales, income, and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase various kinds of merchandise, raw meat, vegetables, and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
If you visit Kisii, a banana growing region in Kenya, you will meet Nelson. For the past 15 years, he has been practising agriculture. He is a father of seven children, and a loving husband too. He makes a living selling milk and bananas. Despite the high transportation costs, Nelson enjoys selling his farm produce in the market place. 

To expand his asset base, Nelson wants to acquire another dairy cow. However, his investment money is tied to farm related costs and school fees. For this simple reason, Nelson is before you seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow, that will produce enough income to enable him to repay the loan and use the surplus to meet personal obligations. Through the loan, he seeks to teach his children that so long as you have a good business idea, money should not be the barrier to achieving your potential.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 41 years old and has four school-going children. Despite the hardship of living, they are determined to educate their children.

Due to insufficient finances, Jonalyn supported her husband in cultivating their farm land by planting vegetables to sell. To improve their farming business, Jonalyn is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production. She believes that the loan will also help them to expand their vegetable plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in vegetable production.

loans.name: Johana María

texts.es:
Johana, a sus 27 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser una mujer activa y trabajadora, que lucha incansablemente para brindarle lo mejor a su hijo de 10 años.
Desde hace aproximadamente 1 año, comenzó a vender mercancía como ropa y calzado, con el fin de generar recursos que le permitieran apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica de su hogar.
Sus principales clientes son familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector, tiene la ventaja de contar con una actitud muy expresiva, lo que le facilita la comunicación con diferentes personas, quienes finalmente se convierten en sus clientes.
El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para fortalecer su stock de mercancía, comprará calzado, especialmente tenis de marcas reconocidas, esto le permitirá abrirse a un mercado más amplio, pues los productos que ofrece son de buena calidad y a precios accesibles; beneficiando así los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Johana, con su espíritu de superación y la proyección hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas, manifiesta que seguirá luchando para salir adelante en compañía de los que ama y brindar una mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Johana, age 27, is known for being an active and hardworking woman who strives tirelessly to provide the best for her 10-year-old son. For about a year she has been selling merchandise, such as clothes and shoes, so that she can generate income to help her husband with the financial responsibilities of their household. Her main customers are relatives, friends, and neighbors from the area. Johana’s advantage is that she has a very expressive attitude, which helps to facilitate communication with different people who eventually become her customers.

The loan she is requesting will help strengthen her stock of merchandise. She will buy footwear, especially tennis shoes of known brands. This will help to expand her market since she will be able to offer good quality products at affordable prices. She will benefit from the income she generates from her work.

With the drive to succeed and the intention of accomplishing her goals, Johana says that she will continue to move forward with those she loves and will provide a better education for her son.

loans.use: to buy footwear, especially brand-name tennis shoes.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia de 44 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene 6 hijos de 6, 10, 15, 17, 18 y 20 años, los cuales 4 viven con ella. Lucia solo estudio sexto grado, ya que tomo la decision de acompañarse. Lucia y su compañero de vida se dedican a la agricultura y crianza de animales desde hace 10 años. Lucia y su compañero de vida están por dedicarse  tambien a la crianza de cerdos de ceda, trabajo que lo aprendio de sus padres. Para llegar a su trabajo Lucia, sus 4 hijos y su coompañero de vida caminan 3 kilometros y trabajan de 7:00 AM a 4:00 PM .

 El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar fertilizantes y asi poder sacar mejor cosecha para obtener mas ingresos y poder dar una mejor vida a su grupo familiar. Lucia, sueña con darles estudios a sus hijos, aumentar la criaza de animales y tambien poder comprar un medio de trasporte para trasladar sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Lucia is 44 years old. She is married and has 6 children who are 6, 10, 15, 17, 18, and 20 years old. Four of them live with her. Lucia only studied until the 6th grade because she made the decision to get married. Lucia and her husband have been working in agriculture and raising animals for 10 years. Lucia and her husband are about to start raising pigs also, which she learned from her parents. To arrive at her job, Lucia, her 4 children and her husband walk 3 kilometers. They work from 7:00a.m. to 4:00p.m.

The loan that Lucia is requesting from Credicampo is for the purchase of fertilizer to improve her harvest, generate more income, and thus give her family a better life. Lucia dreams of giving her children an education, increasing her animal-raising business, and also being able to purchase a means of transport to transport her crops.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Vezire

texts.en:
Vezire, at 61 years old, still runs her own private handicraft business. She and her husband continue to work hard despite their age so they can assist their 3 children and provide a better life for themselves. 

Her husband is still working as an electrician, and she primarily makes clothing and traditional items for celebrations and events, mainly for weddings. She works from home, saving any costs for rent or other expenses and has built up a large and loyal customer base over the years. She is always busy every day and has to work 7 days a week often to fulfill the orders she receives from customers. 

At this time Vezire is requesting a loan in order to purchase material to prepare for the upcoming busy wedding season. This loan will help her to be able to continue her business and be ready for any and all client requests. 

She wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase material to prepare for the upcoming busy wedding season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru:
Зариф энергичный трудолюбивый мужчина. Он женат имеет детей. Пожилые родители живут вместе с ним. Зариф не 
боится жизненных трудностей. Так как у него очень доброжелательный нрав он ладит со всеми и ему не в тягость 
нести ответственность за большую семью. Жена помогает ему и тоже работает. Подрастают дети, они еще учатся в 
школе и на их образование Зариф тоже обращает внимание. Зариф зарабатывает тем, что делает ремонт жилья. Но 
дополнительно для того чтобы улучшить жизненные условия для своих близких он каждый год в сезон созревания 
фруктов и овощей изготавливает и продает деревянные ящики. С наступлением весны Зариф хочет начать изготовление ящиков и сделать запас продукции, но для закупки материалов у него недостает средств. Он решил взять кредит и обратился в "Арванд" 5000 сомони помогут ему приобрести необходимый материал. Зариф заранее благодарен, за оказанную помощь.
texts.en:
Zarif is an energetic and hardworking man.  He is married and he has a family.  His elderly parents live with him.  Zarif is not afraid of life's difficulties.  Since he has a very friendly disposition, he gets along well with everyone and doesn't mind being responsible for a large family.  His wife works and also helps him.  His children are growing but they're still in school and Zarif pays close attention to their education.

Zarif makes a living repairing houses.  In addition to this, and in order to improve his family's living conditions, he also manufactures and sells wooden crates every year during the fruits and vegetables ripening season.

With the onset of spring, Zarif wants to start making a large supply of crates, but he doesn't have enough money to buy the necessary materials.  He has therefore decided to take a loan with Arvand.  The amount of 5,000 somoni will help him to buy the materials he needs.  Zarif thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks.

loans.name: Pato

texts.en:
Pato is 55 years old and is married with two children. She owns and operates a small store, selling groceries such as bags of sugar, boxes of bowl noodles, etc. She has been doing this for six years.

Pato needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, boxes of noodles, chicken, boxes of tinned fish etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business, so she can improve her family's living conditions. She became a member of SPBD in 2008 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, boxes of noodles, chicken, boxes of tinned fish, etc.

loans.name: Ita

texts.en:
Ita is a 46-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, yams etc to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years. 

Ita has requested a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, weed sprayers and an axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Ita hopes to improve her standard of living and also to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, weed sprayers, chemicals and an axe.

loans.name: Malaefono

texts.en:
Malaefono is a 45-year-old married woman with nine children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, ta'amu, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years.

Malaefono has requested a loan to purchase a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, and filings. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2008. 

With her profits, Malaefono will save for her children's education and for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer, filings, and an ax.

loans.name: Intizor

texts.ru: Интизор трудолюбивая и скромная женщина из района Яван. Ей 31 год. Она замужем за дехканина, у них 7-летняя дочь и двое сыновей в возрасте 5 и 9 лет. Дочь и старший сын школьники. Интизор вместе с мужем занимается сельским хозяйством. Уже 10 лет как они выращивают огородные культуры. Прибыль с продажи урожаев является единственным источником дохода семьи. Сейчас их семье необходимо купить семена овощей, чтобы завершить посевные работы. Для этой цели Интизор просит кредит. Она надеется, что летом соберет хороший урожай и за счет прибыли с продажи она сможет провести ремонт в доме и улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en: Intizor is a hardworking and modest woman from the Yavan district.  She is 31 years old.  She is married to a farmer, and they have a 7 year-old daughter and two sons, who are 5 and 9 years old.  The daughter and oldest son are school students.  Intizor and her husband are involved in farming.  They have been growing garden crops for 10 years.  The profit from selling the harvest is the sole source of income for the family.  Now, their family needs to buy vegetable seeds in order to finish sowing work.  Intizor is requesting a loan for this purpose.  She hopes that she will gather a good harvest in the summer and use the profits to make repairs at home and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Mo'amar

texts.en:
Mo'amar is a 24-year-old single man from a small village near Tulkarm city, called Attel. He lives with his family in a small, humble house. Mo'amar works as a farmer on the family land, where he plants seasonal fruits and vegetables, using greenhouses to ensure that he has very good, quality produce. Mo'amar would like to improve his family's land and expand it.
 
Mo'amar applied for a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more raw materials to build new greenhouses for his farm. By taking this loan, Mo'amar will be able to improve his farm and increase the area of land used for agriculture. Mo'amar appears in the photo on his land.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to build new greenhouses for his farm.

loans.name: Jepun Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut, head of the group, tells of her success raising pigs. With the first loan she got from Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK), Ni Ketut obtained one sow. Then, she had two sows and each sow had given birth to nine piglets. She sold the piglets after raising them for two months. 

She saved all of the profits, and they will be used for working capital so that she can be financially independent. Ni Ketut is very grateful for the help she has received so far. She still expects assistance from MUK, both in terms of capital or training, so that she and all members of the group can be a successful pig farmer.

After obtaining satisfactory results in previous loan periods, the Jepun Sari group continues lending. Now, they receive a higher loan amount to increase business. The current loan will be used to purchase piglets, feed, and repair cages. The Jepun Sari group can repay the loan on time. 

Ni Ketut will use the loan to buy feed and repair cages. She will keep six piglets for fattening, and they are scheduled to be sold five months later. She hopes the welfare of her family will be better, and if all goes well, she will increase the number of sows.

loans.use: to buy feed and to repair cages

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Рачабгул вдова, ей 61 год. Она живет с единственным сыном в районе Яван. Рачабгул и ее 26-летний сын занимаются растениеводством. У них имеется приусадебный участок земли, на котором они выращивают сельскохозяйственную культуру, в частности кукурузу, овощи, а также люцерну. Рачабгул занимается земледелием уже 8 лет и ей нравится эта работа. В данный момент ей не хватает немного средств, чтобы приобрести семена для посева. Она нуждается в кредите и ожидает поддержки, чтобы продолжить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Rajabgul is a 61 year-old widow.  She lives with her only son in the Yavan district.  Rajabgul and her 26 year-old son are involved in agriculture.  They have a plot of land by their house, where they grow agricultural crops, such as corn, vegetables and also alfalfa.  Rajabgul has been involved in farming for 8 years and likes this work.  At the present time, she does not have enough money to purchase seeds for sowing.  She needs a loan and awaits support in order to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for the spring sowing

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru: 44-летняя Мунаввар занимается дехканством в своем районе Яван. Муж и двое ее сыновей работают вместе с ней на грядке, а дочь ведет домашнее хозяйство. Более 12 лет как их семья занимается посевом и сбором сельскохозяйственных культур. Они в основном сеят огородные культуры. Это у них единственный источник дохода. Мунаввар и ее семья уже подготовились к посеву, а именно провели вспашку почвы и сделали грядки для посева. Однако они все еще не смогли посадить урожай из-за нехватки финансов. Поэтому Мунаввар решила взять кредит. Им срочно необходимо закупить семена. Помогите им.
texts.en: 44 year-old Munavvar is involved in farming in her district of Yavan.  Her husband and two sons work together with her on the land, and daughter runs a household.  Their family has been involved in sowing and harvesting agricultural crops.  She primarily plants garden crops.  This is their sole source of income.  Munavvar and her family have already gotten ready for the sowing by plowing the soil and making rows for the sowing.  However, they still have not been able to plant the crops due to the lack of finances.  This is why Munavvar decided to obtain this loan.  They urgently need to purchase seeds.  Help them.

loans.use: to buy quality seeds for the seasonal sowing

loans.name: Fallchas De Ausangate Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “Fallchas de Ausangate” de la Asociación Arariwa desde hace varios años atrás y les va muy bien, ellos viven en el distrito de Ocongate de la Provincia de Quispicanchis al sur de la ciudad del Cusco.   

Aniceta tiene 52 años y se dedica a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales menores como cuyes, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, habas, trigo, cebada y otras cosas mas, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y cuyes.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales menores, venta de artesanías y negocio de tienda de abarrotes. Los socios agradecen a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members have belonged to Asociación Arariwa's Fallchas de Ausangate Communal Bank for several years now and it is going very well for them.  They live in the district of Ocongate in Quispicanchis Province, south of the city of Cusco. 

Aniceta is 52 years old and she works in farming, livestock, and breeding small animals, such as guinea pigs.  She has several cultivated plots where she grows potatoes, broad beans, wheat, barley, and other things.  She is a very enterprising and hardworking woman who gets her family ahead.  She currently needs a loan to buy seed and guinea pigs. 

The other bank members work in farming, livestock, and breeding small animals, selling handicrafts, and running a grocery store.  The bank members thank those who are a part of this dream through this medium and they promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seed and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ron

texts.en:
Ron is 52 years of age and a widowed woman living with her six children in Bakan district, Pursat province. Her three eldest children are employed in various careers, while the remaining three children are still students. 

To meet the daily needs of her family, Ron has been involved in agriculture for more than 20 years, primarily farming rice on about two hectares of farmland. 

Ron will use the loan to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household sanitation practices. 

Thanks to the water loan program and a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Ron is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 47-year-old Memunatu. She is married and has four children aged 27, 25, 21 and 19. Two of her children attend school. 

In 1990, Memunatu established her clothing and cosmetics business. Though sales are sometimes slow, she manages and controls her business well. She has successfully repaid her previous loan with very few problems. Her business working capital has increased by two million. She was also able to finish an uncompleted apartment in her compound, and she hopes to send his son who has attained his Senior Secondary School Certificate to college.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, Memunatu earns about Le 2,629,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of Le 4,00,0000. to buy dozens of plastic footwear for the rainy season, baby’s wears and kids' clothing. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of plastic footwear for the rainy season, baby’s wears and kids' clothing.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is 49 years old, married and has one child. He is a tricycle driver and his spouse is a food vendor. He usually earns about PHP 300 a day. Arnold uses his income for his family's sustenance. 

He is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle. This will help maintain his transport business and enable him to save funds for his family's future use.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Devorah

texts.en:
Devorah is 53 years old and lives in Guintomaoyan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is separated with two children who are now adults. 
Devorah has been engaged in the hog raising business for 10 years, and earns approximately PHP 9,000 from each breeding period by selling the piglets and pigs. She has requested a loan to purchase three sacks of feed for her hog raising activities. Devorah became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Devorah hopes to expand her hog raising business.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Ganimete

texts.en:
Ganimete is a mother of four children and a housewife. Her husband works in agriculture. They are currently living in a house that is in urgent need of renovations and needs the doors, windows, and floors to be replaced. 

The windows and doors are not providing adequate insulation and protection from the weather, and the floors are damaged from water and other elements, making the living environment unhealthy and difficult. 

For the first time, she is requesting a loan to purchase new doors, windows, and flooring so that she can have better conditions that she has not been able to afford. 

This loan will help her and her family to have better health, living conditions, and quality of living. Ganimete appreciates all of the help.

loans.use: to purchase new doors, windows, and flooring so that she can have better life conditions.

loans.name: Vehbi

texts.en:
Vehbi wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which has helped him to purchase corn and guano. He is still involved in his agricultural work and is in need again for a loan to buy a milk cow in order to start selling milk for additional income for his family. 

Currently, Vehbi has a cow and he wants to add one more cow in order to expand his farm. This will help him to save expenses on milk and milk products and add income to his family to provide a better quality of life. He hopes that this time he will be more able to improve the living conditions and promises that he will pay on time. He wants to thank all of the lenders for the second loan.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow in order to start selling milk for additional income.

loans.name: Melsiana

texts.en:
Melsiana is applying for a loan of $800 to improve her business. 

She is married and runs a business from her house selling gasoline and diesel. She is making a good income from selling gasoline and diesel, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. Melsiana lives in a town nearby the main road, so many people come to buy from her, and she is busy selling every day. She opened her business a year ago with her working capital of $600.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and diesel to re-sell.

loans.name: Ivana

texts.en:
Ivana, 34, is married and a mother of three. She is a nurse and her husband works for an electrical company, both making very low salaries. In order to earn more income, she is also involved in agriculture, working with her husband on the land planting peppers, tomatoes and other vegetables to sell. 

Until now she has been borrowing a machine to work the land from a cousin. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a machine of her own. This loan will help them to work the land more effectively and efficiently and not have to ask others for help or rely on someone’s machine. She is very thankful and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an agricultural machine for farming.

loans.name: Hugo Javier

texts.es:
Hugo, con 42 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y 5 hijos en una comunidad de Jinotega. Posee una finca de 23.1 Ha. De las cuales 3.5 Ha. son de café, y en las cuales ha logrado cosechar hasta un máximo de 295 quintales de café pergamino, el cual produce bajo criterios de certificación Comercio Justo.

Para este ciclo, este productor está solicitando un financiamiento para la construcción de un beneficio húmedo que le permita garantizar una mayor calidad de su café y disminuir los costos; ya que hasta ahora para suplir esta necesidad lo que ha hecho es alquilar un beneficio para el procesamiento de su café, pero esto incrementa sus costos.

Su objetivo en los próximos años, es ir tecnificando su finca y aumentar las áreas de producción en su pequeña finca, ya que considera que este es un rubro rentable, que le permitirá tener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Hugo, who is 42 years old, lives with his wife and five children in a community of Jinotega.  He has a 23.1-hectare farm, of which 3.5 hectares are coffee and from which he has been able to harvest up to a maximum of 295 quintals of Pergamino coffee.  He produces this in accordance with the criteria for Fair Trade certification.   

For this cycle, this producer is requesting a loan to build a wet processing plant that will allow him to ensure a higher quality coffee and reduce his expenses.  Until now what he has done to meet this need is rent a plant to process his coffee, but this increases his expenses. 

His goal for the next few years is to modernize his farm and increase the productive areas of his small farm, as he believes this is a profitable profession that will allow him to make more income for his family.

loans.use: to build a wet processing plant

loans.name: Fualaau

texts.en: Fualaau, 33, is a married woman with 3 children. She has a small plantation and grows yams, bananas and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. Fualaau has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer, filings and an axe. She has been a member of SBPD since 2014. Fualaau hopes to save the profits for her children.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer, filings and an axe.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has been operating a general store for many years. Her business keeps on growing. 

The previous loan that Rose took out was a big help for her business. She was able to buy more items for her shop. She is requesting another loan to buy more stock for her store, including household goods, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. Rose looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store, including household goods, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Blanca Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca forma parte del grupo de crédito Los Talvos, los créditos le ayudan a mejorar su negocio y sacar adelante a su familia. Vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, es reconocida por su importante producción de maíz, teniendo como atractivos las lagunas de Chochapamba (llenas de Totoras), su gente es trabajadora, amable y gentil.
La Señora Blanc tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 14, 11 y 5 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Blanca pasa en casa al cuidado de su hogar, pero para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cría de pollos, cerdos y cuyes, también a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en alimento para sus animales. Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Talvos”. The loans have helped to improve her business and have allowed her family to move forward. She lives in the neighborhood that surrounds the parish of Valle in the city of Cuenca, which is known for being a major producer of corn and having attractions, such as the Lakes of Chochapamba, which are full of totora reeds. The people are hardworking, friendly, and kind.

Sra. Blanca is 32 years old, married, and has three children (ages 14, 11, and 5). Her oldest daughter is in high school and the two younger children attend an elementary school in town. Her husband works as a bricklayer. They own the house in which they live.

Doña Blanca stays at home and looks after the household. In order to help her husband with the household expenses, she raises chickens, pigs, and guinea pigs. She also grows crops for family consumption and sells any surplus that is left over. They money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and feed for her animals. Her goal is to finish her house.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase provisions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase crates of assorted drinks, bundles of pure water, cartons of tin milk, luncheon meat, rolls, cartons of laundry soap, foam soap, bags of sugar, and sachet milk.

loans.name: Darío Esau

texts.es:
Dario de 48 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 4 hijos de 21, 19, 15 y 3 años, los cuales 3 ya trabajan ayudandole en la agricultura. Dario solo estudio hasta tercer grado, ya que no pudo  seguir por la pobreza en que vivia. Su esposa trabaja en la venta de frutas y verduras, Dario se dedica a la agricultura trabajo que aprendio de sus padres, tambien en el verano le ayuda a su esposa en la venta de frutas y verduras, para llegar al trabajo Dario y su familia caminan dos kilometros y trabajan en el horario de 6:00 AM a 4:00 PM . 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla, abono, fertilizantes, pesticidas y herbicidas, y asi poder sacar mejor cosecha para obtener mas ingresos y dar una mejor vida a su grupo familiar. Dario, sueña con mejorar el negocio, y poder mejorar su vivienda para darles una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Dario is 48 years old. He is married and has 4 children, aged 21, 19, 15 and 3. Three of them work, helping him do the farming. Dario only went to school up to the third grade. He wasn't able to continue because of the poverty he was living in. His wife works selling fruits and vegetables. Dario works in farming, work he learned from his parents. In the summer, he also helps his wife sell fruits and vegetables. To get to work, Dario and his family walk two kilometers and work from 6:00 AM to 4:00 PM. 

The loan he is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides. This way, he can get a better harvest to obtain more income and give his family a better life. Dario dreams of improving the business and being able to improve his home to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Muhamet

texts.en:
Muhamet is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters. He comes from the Ashkali minority community, where, in order to earn a living, he cuts wood to sell for heating and other needs people have. He is also able to fix wood cutting machines for other people. 

Until now, Muhamet's family used to live in a very old house, because the amount of money that he was making from his business was very low and he was not able to afford to improve his situation. Fortunately, his daughters are now married and live in western countries, and they have worked hard to send Muhamet money to build a new house. In order to finish the house though, he is requesting a loan to purchase some of the final materials that he needs to finish the work. The loan will help him to improve his living conditions, for which Muhamet is very grateful.

loans.use: to purchase house materials that he needs to finish his house.

loans.name: Slavisa

texts.en: Slavisa is 48 years old and lives with his wife, their 3 sons and his elderly mother in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. He is employed in a municipality while his wife works as a saleswoman in a market. In addition to their employment, he also owns a metal workshop. He is very talented and has been working in this field for quite some time. He originally started small, working for his family and some neighbors, but when he had developed a good reputation and after increasing his customer base, he decided to open a work shop and become an official business. He makes doors, windows and other metal items that a customer may request and order. Now he is I need of a loan to purchase new tools for his workshop so that he can expand his business and satisfy the needs and demands of his customers. He believes that the loan will help him to improve his business and increase his income even more. He promises to pay on time and grateful for the opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his workshop so that he can expand his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy chickens that she can raise and sell.

loans.name: Los Trejos Group

texts.es: El grupo lo coordina la señora Dania, es una mujer exitosa de 40 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos, pero ninguno depende de ella, se dedica a la venta de comida por encargo a trabajadores de empresas que laboran cercanas a su comunidad, así mismo comercializa cosméticos de las marcas AVON, Arabela y Scential, cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero de vida económicamente, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de granos básicos como es el arroz, frijol, aceite, plátanos verde, plátanos maduros, tomate, zanahoria, entre otros y cosméticos de las marcas antes mencionadas como es perfumes para damas, perfumes para caballeros, vanidades, pinturas labiales, pinturas de uñas, delineadores, y más. Otra socia es la señora Maritza de 41 años de edad que vende ropa nueva en un mercado del departamento más cercano y con el crédito anterior puso una mini pulpería de refrescos y gaseosas y la señora Amalia de 45 años de edad propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, venta de ropa nueva y productos de la Zermat.
texts.en: Señora Dania is the coordinator of this communal bank.  She is a successful 40-year old woman who is married and the mother of two children, neither of whom are dependent on her.  She makes her living selling per-ordered food to the workers at businesses nearby her community.   In addition, señora Dania sells AVON, Arabela and Scential brand cosmetics.  She has her husband's financial support as well.  Señora Dania needs the loan to purchase basic grains, like rice, beans, cooking oil, green bananas, ripe bananas, tomatoes, carrots and other items and well as cosmetics from the above-mentioned brands including perfume, cologne, compacts, lipstick, nail polish, eye liner and other items.  Señora Maritza is another member of the communal bank.  She is 41-years old and sells new clothing in the market of the nearest Department.  With the previous loan, she opened a small grocery that sells soft-drinks and other carbonated beverages.  Señora Amalia, who is 45-years old, owns a small general store that she operates from her home.  She sells new clothing and Zermat products.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, like rice, beans, cooking oil, tomatoes, green bananas, ripe bananas and cosmetics, such as lipstick, eye-liners, nail polish etc.

loans.name: Juan Orlando

texts.es:
Juan Orlando vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en una comunidad de Jinotega. En su pequeña finca cultiva café y granos básicos para el autoconsumo. El café es la principal actividad económica de este productor que está integrado al proceso de certificación Comercio Justo.

En los últimos años ha mejorado su producción de café, y su meta es aumentar el área de cultivo de este rubro para mejorar sus ingresos. Actualmente, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas a fin de garantizar la nutrición de 2.1Ha. de café, y asegurar una buena cosecha para el ciclo actual, que le permita incrementar sus ingresos y darle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Orlando lives with his wife and his three children in a neighborhood of Jinotega. On his small farm, he cultivates coffee and basic grains for on-farm consumption. Coffee is the main economic activity for Juan Orlando, who is in the process of becoming Fair Trade certified. 

In the last few years, he has improved his coffee production and his goal is to increase his land dedicated to the cultivation of coffee in order to improve his earnings. Currently, he is requesting a loan to purchase agricultural inputs in order to guarantee the health of his 2.1 hectares of coffee and to assure a good harvest this season. This would permit him to increase his earnings and better provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for his coffee farm

loans.name: Gabriel Climaco

texts.es:
Gabriel Clímaco, es un productor quien trabajó como técnico eléctrico y al jubilarse decidió dedicarse a la caficultura; actividad económica que ha mantenido en los últimos 10 años y con la cual ha sostenido a su esposa y 6 hijos. Don Gabriel es un emprendedor que reinvierte parte de sus utilidades en su finca. Con esto ha logrado un aumento en los rendimientos de sus cosechas.

Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para la renovación de 1.4 Ha. de café, a fin de mejorar la productividad de su plantación, al tener plantas en edad productiva. Complementario a esta inversión, él también está haciendo otras gestiones para el mantenimiento de su cafetal, todo esto como parte del plan de manejo integral de su finca. 

La renovación de las plantaciones es una actividad que este pequeño productor se ha propuesto realizar de manera paulatina, a fin de contar con plantaciones jóvenes de edad productiva, que le aseguren buenos rendimientos y con ellos mayores ingresos para brindarle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Gabriel Clímaco is a producer who worked as an electrical technician and then decided to grow coffee when he retired. He has worked at this business activity for the past 10 years and it has allowed him to support his wife and six children. Don Gabriel is an entrepreneur who reinvests part of his profits into his farm. As a result, he has been able to achieve an increase in the output from his harvests.

He is currently requesting a loan in order to replenish 1.4 hectares of coffee with plants of productive age so that he can improve the productivity of his farm. To complement this investment, he will also take additional steps to maintain his coffee farm as part of a comprehensive management plan.

Replanting is an activity that this small producer has decided to undertake in a gradual manner. In the end, he will have young productive plants that will ensure good yields and bring about more income so that he can provide better conditions for his family.

loans.use: to replenish 1.4 hectares of coffee fields.

loans.name: Velia Liliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ROSITA DE LOA ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Velia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia vende su mercadería a sus distintos clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual  le tare satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar materiales como cemento entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank "ROSITA DE LOA ANGELES," which is located in the district of San Sebastián, in the province of Cusco, in the Cusco Department. 

Velia is continuing with her business purchasing and selling construction materials. She sells her merchandise to the many customers who solicit her business. She has been in this business for a long time and it gives her both personal and financial satisfaction. She wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials, including cement. Velia is grateful for the loan she has been granted and she promises to make the payment installations.

loans.use: to buy materials like cement, among other things

loans.name: Las Encantadoras Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por cinco socias exitosas en sus negocios, lo coordina la señora María de 30 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las  edades de 5 y 1 año, se dedica a vender en las calles de su comunidad platanitos, enchiladas de masas, papitas y todo lo que sea relacionado, cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana para freir y también en vender, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de plátanos, papas, aceite, bolsas, repollo, y más, la socia con el crédito anterior obtuvo mejoras en su negocio como fue la compra de peroles nuevos y cucharones, aumentando así sus ganancias, ésto la ha motivado a seguir prestando en esta institución. Otra socia es la señora María de 23 años que comercializa legumbres como cebolla, tomate, chiltoma y más, la señora Sandra de 36 años quien elabora tamales pisques y ofrece a los al rededores de la comunidad y venta de sopa dos veces por semanas en su domicilio, la señora María de 35 años quien compra cosechas de temporada y el dinero lo invertirá en cosechas de aguacate, y la señora María de 52 años propietaria de una mini pulpería  y venta de frutas por mayor.
texts.en:
The group is made up of five women who are successful in their businesses. The group is coordinated by María who is 30 years old, has a partner, and is the mother of two children who are five and one years old. She makes a living selling plantains, local style enchiladas, potatoes, and all that comes with that, on the streets of her community. Her sister helps her to fry and sell.

She needs the loan to buy plantains, potatoes, oil, bags, cabbage, and more. With the previous loan she was able to improve her business by purchasing new pots and ladles. This increased her profits and has motivated her to continue borrowing from this institution.

Another member is María who is 23 years old and sells vegetables such as onion, tomato, peppers, and more. Sandra is 36 years old and makes red bean tamales which she offers to her neighbors in the community. She also sells soup twice a week from her home. Thirty-five-year-old María buys seasonal harvests. She will use the money to invest in avocado harvests. Finally, the 52-year-old María is the owner of a mini-mart and sells fruit wholesale.

loans.use: to buy green plantains, potatoes, oil, bags, dough, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert lives at Buntun with his wife and three children. He is a tricycle driver and generates about PHP 300 - 500 a day. He uses his income for the family's expenses, for meals, electric bills and childrens' allowance at school. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy gasoline and crude oil, and pay for maintenance of the motorcycle. 

Albert hopes to gain more income from his business and continously provide better services to all his passengers.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and crude oil, and pay for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cartons of flasks, cool man and enamel set pans.

loans.name: Nemanja

texts.en:
Nemanja is a single 23-year-old male who is a very hard worker and tries to do all he can to earn and save for his future. He is living at home with his entire family, including his grandfather who is receiving a pension while his father works in a municipality. 

Nemanja strives to help his family have better living conditions. Their home is very old and there has never been an opportunity to renovate it as needed, so he is asking for a loan for the first time, to plaster the façade outside the house and to create an annex with one room.
