He knows that this will help the family have better living conditions and improve their quality of life. He is grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to plaster the façade outside the house and to create an annex with one room.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 45 years old and is married with four children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Tina has requested a loan to buy a frying pan, bags of flour, sugar, oil, baking powder, and a gas oven. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tina will save the profits for her children's education as well.

loans.use: to buy a frying pan, bags of flour, sugar, oil, baking powder, and a gas oven.

loans.name: Mohannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is a 21-year-old single young man from a small village called Bet Sahor near Bethlehem city. He lives with his parents and brothers in a small house. 

Mohannad has a musical talent, which is playing the keyboard. He loves it very much, and he always dreams to improve his talent. Mohannad now is a student in a local university. He would like to create a band and start his musical work. 

Mohannad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new musical keyboard for his new business. By taking this loan, Mohannad will be able to achieve his dream and have his own musical band. 

Mohannad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new musical keyboard for his new business.

loans.name: Sokkhoeurn

texts.en:
Sokkhoeurn is 29 years old, single and a resident living in Preah Sihanouk ville. Sokkhoeurn is currently a first year student, studying for a masters degree at Build Bright University. His major is English, the major that he loves and thinks that it is suitable for his personality. 

Aside from his course of study, Sokkhoeurn works as a teacher of English in a private school and an assistant professor at his university. From his current careers, he is able to generate an income of USD 11.00 per day.
 
Sokkhoeurn is taking this loan from HKL as his first cycle loan, which will be used to pay for his educational fees. With this loan amount, he hopes to be professional, earn a master degree and have a well-paid job in the future. Sokkhoeurn is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via the Kiva program, to enable poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for his educational fees.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ROSITA DE LOA ANGELES, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de San Sebastián, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Susana continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva bue tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende diferentes productos como leche, golosinas, arroz entre otros, la socia continua trabajando durante el dia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, golosinas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the communal bank "ROSITA DE LOA ANGELES," which is located in the district of San Sebastián, in the province of Cusco, in the Cusco Department. 

Susana is continuing her business of running a grocery store. She has been in business for a long time and her work brings her both economic and personal satisfaction. She sells many different products like milk, sweet treats, and rice among other goods. She will continue working during the whole day. Susana wants to be able to continue working this way so that she can continue supporting her family. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of rice, treats, and other merchandise. Susana is grateful for the loan she has been granted and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, treats, and other merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy computers and mobile phones for sale

loans.name: Mervete

texts.en:
Mervete is from the Ashkali minority community, where she lives with her husband and three children. 

Although her husband owns his own construction company, Mervete is a very hardworking woman, taking care of the children, the home and helping her husband with his business. With his father and brother, Mervete’s husband works on homes and businesses, doing the façades, structures, repairs, and renovations. 

Mervete is now asking for a loan to purchase additional tools for her husband’s construction business. She knows that with new tools, the quality of the work that they produce will be better and they will also have an easier time completing the work, allowing for them to do more jobs and requests to increase their income. 

She is very grateful for the opportunity to improve her family’s living conditions and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Savoern's Group

texts.en:
Savoern is 41 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. 

To make a living, Savoern has been growing corn and also working for others for a fee, to earn additional income for her family. Having been in these businesses for two years, she is able to earn more income from her current business.

This is the second loan for Savoern with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans to better support her family. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Sala

texts.en:
Sala, aged 43, is from the Ashkali minority community where she lives with her husband and their seven children. 

Her husband owns his own male hairdressing business and Sala helps him to maintain the business where she works as a cleaner. She is happy to be doing this type of work as it means that her husband does not have to hire a cleaner and it saves them a lot of money monthly. It is also the type of work that allows her be in charge of her schedule and be able to be at home for her children when they need her. 

Her husband’s business needs some improvements now, and she is requesting a loan in order purchase new inventory such as mirrors, tables and chairs. The loan will help them to have a more modern and newer look, which should attract more customers and help them to retain their current customers. 

Sala hopes that in the future she will be able to find a job and contribute more to the family budget. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new inventory such as mirrors, tables and chairs for her husband's hairdressing business.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Savorn is 28 years old, and is married with one child. She and her husband have struggled to feed their family by farming rice, raising cows and fishing for two years. The current business earns her approximately 32,000 KHR per day.
 
Savorn has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a blacksmith's press, a batch of steel, and various tools

loans.name: Sose

texts.en:
Sose is 42 years old and is married with seven children. She sews and sells clothes to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. 

Sose needs a loan to buy a sewing machine, thread, needles, scissors and materials. She hopes to use her profits to support her family and for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, needles, scissors and materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Gaosa

texts.en:
Gaosa is a 32-year-old single woman with one child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Gaosa has requested a loan to buy oil, bags of sugar, bags of flour, baking powder, a frying pan and a gas oven. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Gaosa will save her profits to support her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, bag of sugar, bag of flour, baking powder, a frying pan and a gas oven.

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en:
Sabri is married and lives with his wife and their two children, aged 4 and 7 years old. 

Sabri works as a guard, but his salary is very low and barely enough to support his family. Therefore, for the last two years, Sabri has also been running his own private auto service business where he fixes cars and other vehicles. He has a lot of customers and is very busy, as his business continues to grow. Now, he is asking for a loan to purchase the necessary tools for repairing cars and for a new auto mechanic lift as his lift is old and needs to be replaced. 

This loan will help him to generate more income and he hopes to be able to save money for his family’s future. Sabri appreciates all of the Kiva lenders

loans.use: to purchase the necessary tools for repairing cars and for a new auto mechanic lift.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is 47 years old and is married with three children. She is from a rural village located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. 

Sambath and her husband earn a living through farming rice and fishing. They have been in this business for 15 years. The current business earns her family about 100,000 KHR per day to support her family. She can manage to save about 40,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
  
This is Sambath’s second loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and she completely repaid the previous loan. She is now leading her group of two to apply for a loan. Sambath will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on land plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov is a 47-year-old mother of ten children, living in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. 

To make a living, Pov and her husband have been farming rice, beans and watermelon, and supplementing their income by working as paid workers. She currently earns about 13,000 KHR per day.
 
This is Pov's sixth micro-loan with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Pov is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Zenije

texts.en:
Zenije is 42 years old, married and has one son. She works in a dry cleaners and her husband works in construction. 

Although they are both working, their salaries are still very low. They are able to provide for the basic needs for their family, but not able to save any additional money or use it for other expenses. They both work very hard at improving their lives and their quality of living, and are always grateful for what they can do and have. 

Through the years, they have been able to manage to build themselves a new home but have not been able to finish the roof. Now, they are requesting a loan in order to complete the work on the roof so that their home can finally be complete and they will not have to worry about any water damage or loss of heat and increased utility expenses. 

Zenije hopes to be able to provide her son with better living conditions and a better life, as well as provide for an education. She promises to pay on time and thanks all of the lenders.

loans.use: to complete work on the roof of her house.

loans.name: María Matías

texts.es:
María de 38 años de edad,  es madre de ocho hijos quienes viven con ella y su esposo con quien se acompaño hace ya 10 años, sus hijos son siete hembras y un varón, a quienes por faltas de recursos económicos  no están estudiando.
Su esposo  trabaja en la herrería  (elaboración de cumas) las cuales comercializa en la ciudad los días domingos en las plazas. En casa  viven sus hijos y una nieta a quienes tiene que darles el sustento diario, son una familia muy unida y es cliente desde hace ya cuatro años de estar trabajando con la institución.
Sus hijos trabajan en la herrería y le apoyan en el cuido de su pequeña tienda y trabajos de la agricultura.

María posee  una tienda en su hogar desde hace ya cinco años, cuando emprendió dicha actividad y hasta el momento esta con la tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad (arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevos, azúcar, verduras, cal, golosinas y otros productos de la canasta básica), lo realiza gracias a su esmero en los negocios, también se dedica al destazo de cerdos y  res, hace venta de pan  y de tamales, los cuales con el apoyo de sus hijas mayores le apoyan a ir a venderlo a la comunidad y a la ciudad.
Además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y la ganadería en pequeña escala.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a credicampo, es parar comprar una vaca valorada en $500 la cual ya la tiene tratada en la comunidad, los otros $500 los invertirá para surtir la tienda , ya que gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado obtener un local en el mercado central de la comunidad y quiere comprar mercadería y tener variado para lograr obtener mejores ingresos económicos, pues que la semana entrante del presente mes inicia en el local que tiene en el mercado.

 Con ello lograra mejores condiciones que le permitirán darle a su familia mejor calidad de vida.


El sueño principal que tiene María, es construir su casa de ladrillo en los próximos años y para ello lucha día con día en compañía de sus hijos, pues con los créditos anteriores compro su terreno donde tiene una casa de bahareque y luego instalo la energía eléctrica. Además sueña con ir aumentando poco a poco su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 38 years old and is the mother of eight children who live with her and her husband. She has been in a relationship for 10 years. Her children include seven daughters and one son. They do not attend school because of a lack of financial resources. Her husband is a blacksmith who produces machetes and then sells them in the city plazas on Sundays. María and her husband live at home with their children and a granddaughter, so the must provide for their daily needs. They are a very close family. María has been a client of CrediCampo for four years.

María’s children work at her husband’s blacksmith shop, help with managing her small store, and take care of the farming duties. She has a store in her home that she started five years ago. At the moment, she sells basic necessities such as rice, beans, oil, eggs, sugar, vegetables, salt, snack foods, and other household products. Maria also butchers pigs and cows and prepares bread and tamales for sale. Her older daughters help her with making sales in their community and in the city. On top of that, she raises pigs and cattle on a small scale.

The loan she is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy a cow that is valued at $500 and will be acquired in her community. The remaining $500 will be invested in the restocking of her store. Thanks to her efforts, she was able to acquire a space at the central market in her community. She wants to buy a variety of merchandise so that she can generate better earnings. Maria will begin occupying her space at the market within the next week. With the income she earns, she will be able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

María’s main wish is to build a brick house within the next few years, so she and her children strive each day toward this goal. With her previous loans, she was able to buy a plot of land with an adobe house and eventually had electricity installed. In addition, she dreams of gradually expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en su casa propia de material rústico, en el distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa en su domicilio y caseríos aledaños, así como también cuenta con una pequeña bodega, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maruja is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and children in a house that they own and is made of rustic materials. They reside in the District of Pucara, a community that has a warm climate. The people engage in agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. This area is located in Jaén Province, which is part of the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru.

Maruja sells clothes from her home and in the surrounding villages. She has also has a small grocery store that is located in her house. Maruja is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN so that she can buy a variety of clothes that she can offer to her customers. This will help her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 43 years old. She is married to Vicente and they have five children. Her spouse is a tricycle driver while she sells peanut butter to the people in their village. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to invest in her spouse's business. He will buy gasoline and oil for his motorcyle and she will buy peanuts for her peanut-butter selling business. This will help offer good transport services and products to all their customers. 

Vilma hopes to keep improving their income and to continue to give a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and oil for her husband's motorcyle and peanuts to sell peanut butter

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village in the Sangke district where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Nary is a 31-year-old mother of three children. Pig raising and alcohol distilling are the main sources of her family’s income. She and her husband have been in these businesses for 11 years. They can earn about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the seventh microloan for Nary with VisionFund. Nary has successfully used the loan to better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feed for her pigs. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed for her pigs

loans.name: Novica

texts.en:
Novica is a52-year-old single male. He lives in a small village in a minority community with his mother who receives a pension. Novica is involved in agricultural work in order to earn a living and provide for him and his mother. He owns some cows and plants corn and wheat on his land. He considers this type of business profitable and works hard to care for his mother. 

He also works on the land of others for a fee and needs a loan in order to purchase a new machine that will help him to be able to work more effectively and efficiently, allowing him to work on more land in a shorter period of time. This will provide even more income and opportunity for him. He hopes in the future to continue with his business and is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase new farming equipment

loans.name: Choern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Moung Russey district, Choern is 24 years old and married with one kid. The main source of the family’s income is from rice farming, which she and her husband have been doing for two years to make a living. She and her husband can earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Choern’s group consists of three members and she has been with VisionFund for one cycle. She completely paid back her past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of loan to pay for labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Jasminka

texts.en:
Jasminka is a lovely 28-year-old woman who is a mother of three children. She lives with her kids and husband in a minority community in Kosovo. As most people in their village, they are involved in agricultural work in order to make a living. They have their own land where they plant corn and wheat to use for their own consumption as well as to sell in the area for profit. 

They work hard on their land in order to be able to provide for their family and usually are satisfied with the income earned this way. Jasminka has said, “I will never change my profession; I love my land and am satisfied with the income”. However, she is now in need of a trailer for the tractor so that they can transport their products after the harvest in order to sell them. She hopes in the future to be able to save money from her business to give her children a better education and therefore a better future.

loans.use: To buy a trailer for the tractor to transport their harvest

loans.name: Apaula

texts.en: Apaula is a 34-year-old woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taamu, taro, and banana to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Apaula has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and an axe. She became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Apaula hopes to save for unexpected emergencies and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and an axe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy chicks for poultry farming

loans.name: Valle Verde Group

texts.es: El grupo está integrado por seis socios trabajadoras, lo coordina la señora  Ada de 58 años de edad, casada, se dedica a la venta comida todo los días y los fines de semana aumenta la venta con fritanga, lo comercializa en un kiosko cercano al pozo de agua de ENACAL de su comunidad, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de alimentos como es el quintal de arroz, frijoles, aceite, carne de res, carne de pollo, plátano verde, plátano, maduro, entre otros, cuenta con la ayuda de una trabajadora los fines de semanas, el resto de la semana solamente ella es la encargada de elaborar dicho producto. Otra socia es la señora Elba de 59 años que comercializa cosmético de la Zermat, ropa de segunda y venta de bisutería, también la socia María que tiene una pulpería en su domicilio, la señora Juana que se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, elotes, enchiladas y todo lo que pueda ofrecer en las calles de su comunidad y en su domicilio vende hielo y frijoles cocidos, el señor Javier quién ofrece a personas de escasos recursos préstamos para que se ayuden, de manera que subsanen un poco la crisis que presentan y por último, pero no menos importante, tenemos a la socia Lucía la cual vende comida en su domicilio todos los días.
texts.en: The group consists of six working members, and is coordinated by 58 year old Ada who's married and works every day selling food. On weekends she increases sales with fried foods, selling it at a stand near the ENACAL water well in her community. She needs the loan to purchase foods such as a hundredweight of rice, beans, oil, beef, chicken, green plantains, bananas, ripe plantains, and has an assistant to help her on weekends. The rest of the week she's in charge of making the aforementioned product on her own. Another member is 59 year old Elba who sells Zermat cosmetics, second hand clothes and jewelry. Also there's the member Maria who has a grocery store in her home and Juana who sells beverages, corn, enchiladas and everything she's able to sell on the streets of her community as well as selling ice and cooked beans from home. Javier offers loans to low-income people to give them a hand so they can get through hard times and last but not least the member Lucia sells food from her home every day.

loans.use: To purchase products such as rice, beans, beef, green plantain, ripe plantains, marucham soups, oil, etc.

loans.name: Soolefai

texts.en: "Soolefai is 29 years old and a single woman with 3 children. She runs a small business selling chicken curry, rice, etc. in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Soolefai has requested a loan to buy a gas oven, potatoes, onions, flour, etc. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. She will use her earnings to save for her children's education and to support her family financially."

loans.use: to buy a gas oven, potatoes, onions, flour, etc.

loans.name: Srey Tol's Group

texts.en:
Srey Tol is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 27 years old and married with one kid who is still small and in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice and supplementing her income by working as a paid worker. She has been engaged in these businesses for eight years, earning about 100,000 KHR per day. 

Srey Tol has just been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sonja

texts.en:
Sonja is 53 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a minority community in Kosovo. She works as a doctor and her husband works as a technician in the hospital, but they both make a very low salary. Because of this, they have not been able to renovate or improve their house and their living conditions.
 
She is now requesting a loan in order to façade the house and pay for the materials and labor needed. This will help her to improve their living conditions and the overall health of her family as well as decrease their monthly expenses by creating better insulation to keep heat inside. She hopes in the future, to have more money to give her children a better education.

loans.use: To pay for the materials and labor needed to façade the house

loans.name: Ret

texts.en:
Age 52 years old, Ret is a married mother of five children in a rural village in the Cheung Prey District, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Rice farming is the main source of her family’s income and her husband supplements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 15 US$ per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Ret is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Dalin

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Dalin is 26 years old and married with one child. To make a living and support her family, Dalin and her husband have been farming rice as their primary business for 8 years. Dalin supplements their income by working as a garment worker. She and her husband can earn about 26,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day to meet their family’s needs.

This is Dalin's first micro loan with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Ndèye Sophie

texts.fr: Ndèye Sophie est une femme qui évolue dans la commercialisation  des produits alimentaires. Elle est mariée et mère de famille qui aide son mari dans la gestion  des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité  de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 10ans et demande ce montant pour acheter des produits alimentaires comme le riz, huile, sucre, lait pour les revendre à ses clients. Elle démarre sa journée à 7h pour la finir à 19h. Elle souhaite à l’avenir élargir sa boutique et diversifier ses produits afin de pouvoir augmenter ses revenus et épargner de l’argent. Ainsi elle pourra améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Ndèye Sophie is a woman whose business is to sell food products. She is a married mother who helps her husband in managing daily expenses and her children's tuition fees.

She has over 10 years' experience and is requesting this loan amount to buy food products such as rice, oil, sugar, milk for resale to her customers. She starts her day at 7 am to finish at 7 pm.

In the future she wants to expand her shop and diversify her products in order to increase revenues and save money. Thus she will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy food products for resale

loans.name: Meri

texts.en: Meri is 25 years old. She lives in the district of Kutaisi with her pensioner grandmother. Her father works abroad and sends her money every month. Meri decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The Start-up Program, which is a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $1300 to start a trading business. Meri will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and then resell them in Kutaisi at a higher price to generate a profit. The Start-up Program will provide great support for Meri as she will have her own business and a stable income. She does not have any experience in trading but is very motivated and thinks that her business will be profitable. Meri awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to start up her own business trading in clothes

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya lives in Yerevan town with her three grown up children.

Zoya sells flowers from a small rented space in the center of Yerevan. Her children bring income to the family as well, but Zoya feels very responsible for gathering income and helping them with the family's costs.

Now this hardworking woman, with a perfect credit history behind her, is applying for this loan.

She plans to repair the storage area where she keeps flowers and also purchase a new stock of supplies to sell to her customers. Zoya will be very grateful if lenders support her small retail business.

loans.use: to pay for repair of her storage area and purchase a new stock of supplies

loans.name: Tofamamao

texts.en: Tofamamao is a 52-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells pork pans, donuts, coconut buns, etc. in her community to earn a living. She has seven years of experience in this business. Tofamamao needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast and a gas oven. She plans to use her profits to maintain her business for her family development. Tofamamao has been a member of SPBD since 2008.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast and a gas oven.

loans.name: Snezana

texts.en:
Snezana wants to thank all of the lenders for her previous loan. She has used it to reconstruct the roof of her house and to put on a new façade, thereby improving her family's living conditions. She is still working as a medical sister in a hospital.

Snezana is also involved now in an agricultural business, planting different vegetables and fruits such as peppers, tomatoes, and strawberries and then selling them. She works a lot and works very hard to improve her family's living conditions and takes any opportunity she has to do so. She would like to build a greenhouse so she can grow more products for longer seasons and be able to keep them fresh longer. A loan for this purpose would help her to increase her business and her income and thus allow her to improve her family's living conditions and standard of living. She is again very grateful for the help from the lenders!

loans.use: to build a greenhouse so she can grow more products for longer seasons

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Meet Rosemary, a mother of six. She has been doing agriculture for the past 31 years! She lives with her family in Kitale, Kenya. She gets by selling milk and maize grains. Dairy farming is the activity she enjoys most. Her four cows are called Mrembo, Kadogo, Swara and Lap. However, animal diseases pose a great challenge to Rosemary. She is a member of Juhudi Kilimo, which finances farmers with loans to improve their farming activities and their livelihoods.
 
Rosemary is banking on your support to purchase a dairy cow. She strongly believes in seeking short-term loans to leverage small businesses, thus maximizing returns. With growth in her income from the additional cow, Rosemary will be able to offer quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Due to financial hardships, Gina aims to improve her small retail store to increase her income and support the education of her four children. She would like to increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' demands but she has limited capital. For this reason, Gina is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of laundry soaps, snack foods, beverages, noodles, eggs, seasonings and soft drinks to sell in her store. Being a hard working mother, she believes that someday, she will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of laundry soaps, snack foods, beverages, noodles, eggs, seasonings and soft drinks to sell

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Bintumwa Group

texts.fr:
Anatole fait partie du groupe Bintumwa et habite à  Gitega. Il a 33 ans et est marié à Concilie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 1 à 8 dont 2 étudient. 

Il  fait le commerce de  bière de banane depuis 8 ans.

Il est à son treizième crédit avec Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes  pour préparer beaucoup de litres de bière de banane à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait acheter des lopins de terre et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Anatole is part of the Bintumwa group and lives in Gitega. He is 33 years old and is married to Concilie, a crop farmer. Together they have four children from one to eight years old, of whom two attend school. 

He has been selling banana beer for the past eight years. 

This is his thirteenth credit loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas, and prepare many liters of banana beer for sale, to earn more. 

In coming years, he would like to buy plots of land and ensure his children's education.

loans.use: increase his capital and buy a large quantity of bananas, to produce many liters of banana beer for sale, to earn more.

loans.name: Wendwaoga 3 Mogtedo 3 Group

texts.fr:
Mme HABARAKA  représente le groupe WENDWAOGA 3 MOGTEDO 3.  SALAMATA se porte bien mais cède sa place à HABARAKA. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 05ans.  04 vont à l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.
Mme est étuveuse de riz depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à  Mogtedo. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 tonnes de riz.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut s’acheter une moto. Mme ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Habaraka is now the representative of the Wendwaoga 3 Mogtedo 3 group.  Salamata (former group representative) is doing well but she is handing her responsibilities over to Habaraka.  Habaraka is married and the mother of six children.  Her oldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is 5.  Four of her children are in school and she has a total of seven dependents.

Habaraka has been parboiling rice for a living for the past ten years.  She buys her supplies in Mogtedo.  She is planning to buy two tonnes of rice.  She will use her profits to buy a motorcycle.  Her goal is to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy two tonnes of rice.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 44-year-old Iraqi married woman. She has two children and she works to support her husband in meeting the family's living expenses. She is a seamstress and has her own modest workshop at home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child by assisting her mother, who was also a seamstress. In 1999, Safaa started providing tailoring services from her house to earn a living. She gained great experience in the field and provides good quality at great prices.

Safaa is requesting a loan of $1,200 U.S. dollars (USD). She will use the loan to buy two specialized sewing machines. She believes that, with this loan, she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits. The most important thing is that she will be able to provide her family with a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy two specialized sewing machines

loans.name: Chengly

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village in the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province, Chengly is 27 years old and married. She has one kid. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice and making Khmer Noodles. The current business earns her family about US $21 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Chengly is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is applying for a loan to buy a decent motorbike to help her to transport the Khmer Noodles to customers. She hopes to have a decent motorbike to reduce some expenses she has for a motor-taxi.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is 42 years old, married and a resident of Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She earns a living through her sari-sari store.

She has been a member of PMPC for seven years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,900 to restock her sari-sari store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods and noodles.

Monaliza deeply wishes to maintain her membership in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with basic commodities like rice, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Wendwaoga1 Mogtedo 1 Group

texts.fr:
Mme HABIBOU représente le groupe WENDWAOGA 1 MOGTEDO 1. CLAIRE se porte bien et cède sa place à HABIBOU. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 30ans et le moins âgé a 21ans.  02 vont à l’école et a 10 personnes en charge.
Mme est étuveuse de riz depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Mogtedo. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02 tonnes de riz.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut s’acheter une moto. Mme ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Habibou represents the Wendwaoga 1 Mogtedo 1 group. Claire is doing well and is replaced by Habibou, who is a married mother of five children. The oldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 21. Two attend school and she has overall ten persons to care for. 

She has been parboiling rice for the past ten years. She resupplies in Mogtedo, and wants to buy two tons of rice. 

With her profits, she would like to buy a motorcycle. Her ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: buy two tons of rice

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan, 55, lives with her husband and six children in a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Yan and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been farming rice for several years, earning about 27,000 KHR per day to spend for her family’s needs. To supplement her income, she has been working as a paid worker.
  
Yan has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to generate more income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 53 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children now all adult ages.

Leonila has been engaged in operating a public utility van business for four years and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month from doing this type of business. She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations. Leonila has been a member of PMPC almost two years. In the future, Leonila hopes to purchase additional PUV units for her business.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for house repairs and renovations

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy food and charcoal.

loans.name: Andrómeda Group

texts.es: El grupo lo coordina la señora Sandy de 27 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 6 años y un bebé de 5 meses de nacido, se dedica a comercializar pescados, es por este motivo que requiere el crédito para aumentar la compra de pescados, pues es el alimento que más demanda está teniendo por lo que está próxima la semana santa, así podrá ofrecerlo en el mercado de su comunidad, el negocio lo impulsó hace cuatro años y siempre ha contado con la ayuda de su mamá. Otro integrante es el socio Isidoro de 24 años de edad dedicado a la pesca, la socia Nancy de 21 años estilista a domicilio y requiere instalar su propio negocio en su vivienda y la socia Theylin de 27 años propietaria de una panadería en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is coordinated by Sandy, who is 27 years old, in a relationship, and the mother of two children, a six-year-old and a five-month-old baby.  She sells fish for a living, which is why she needs this loan to increase her fish buying as it is the food in highest demand during the coming Holy Week.  This will allow her to sell at her local market.  She started her business four years ago and she has always had her mother's help.  Another member of this group is 24-year-old Isidoro who fishes; 21-year-old member Nancy is an independent stylist and needs to set up her own business at home; and 27-year-old member Theylin runs a bakery in her home.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Enma Lulu

texts.es: La socia Emma es una mujer exitosa en su vida laboral, tiene la edad de 62 años, está casada y es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para la compra de los productos, así mismo le ayuda a despachar los productos ofrecidos, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como es pan, agua purificada por bidón, gaseosas, aceite, tortas, y todo lo que se ofrece en la pulpería. La socia se ha propuesto aumentar su negocio y lograr convertirlo en una miscelánea, por tal razón la socia quiere el crédito y pide que se le ayude.
texts.en:
Emma is a successful woman in her work life. She is 62 years old, married, and is the owner of a shop in her home. Her husband helps her in purchasing products as well as in sending the offered products.

She needs this loan to buy products like bread, large bottle of purified water, soft drinks, oil, cakes, and everything she offers at the shop. She has plans to expand the business and covert it into a mini-mart. This is why she wants this loan and is asking for help.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as bread, purified water, soft drinks, oil, etc.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquín, es un productor que vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. A sus 40 años y con el apoyo de su compañera de vida y 8 hijos, ha logrado en la caficultura los ingresos económicos necesarios para salir adelante como agricultor.

Este pequeño productor está integrado al proceso de certificación de Comercio Justo, y con 3.85 hectáreas de café, logró producir en el último ciclo 136 quintales pergamino. Genera en promedio, hasta 4 empleos en el año.
 
Para este ciclo, Joaquín está solicitando un crédito para asegurar la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que le permita asegurar la demanda de nutrición de sus plantaciones, y con ello obtener mejores rendimientos. El incremento de su producción, así como el de la calidad de su café son las metas que este productor se ha propuesto para mejorar la productividad de su finca y con ello las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Joaquín is a farmer who lives in a community in northern Nicaragua.  At 40 years old and with the support of his life partner and eight children, he has been able to generate the income necessary to succeed as a farmer through coffee growing.   

This small farmer is part of the Fair Trade certification process, and with 3.85 hectares of coffee, he was able to produce 136 quintals of parchment coffee last cycle.  He generates an average of up to four jobs per year. 

This cycle Joaquín is requesting a loan to ensure the purchase of fertilizers and manures that will meet the nutrition needs of his crops and provide him with better produce.  Increasing the production as well as the quality of his coffee are the goals this farmer has set to improve the viability of his farm and, with it, his family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manures

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan es un socio exitoso de 39 años de edad, soltero y dedicado a la pesca, éste es un alimento muy demandado en su comunidad y el crédito lo invertirá en compra de maya de pescar, más pescados a otros que se dedican a la pesca para comercializarlo en el mercado de municipal y así poder aumentar sus ganancias y lograr mejoras  en su vida.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is a successful man. He is 39 years old, single and make his living fishing. This product is in high demand in his community.

He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of a net to fish and more fish from others who also make their living catching fish to sell them in the municipal market. In this way he will be able to increase his profits and make improvements to his life.

loans.use: to buy a net and fish from other fishermen.

loans.name: Sonia Yasmid

texts.es:
Sonia, nació el 25 de octubre en una vereda, desde aquel entonces  se ha destacado como una persona emprendedora, con valores como el respeto, honestidad, sinceridad, trabajadora  capaz de salir adelante, a pesar de los obstáculos que ha enfrentado en la vida demuestra la capacidad de salir adelante y así cumplir con las metas propuestas. A los 6 años Inicia los estudios, en el 2010 queda embarazada de la primer niña que hoy en día tiene 4 años, interrumpe los estudios y en  siguiente muestra el empeño por continuar los estudios, realiza el grado décimo y once en un escuela para poder lograr los estudios de bachillerato. 
Nuevamente  decide ser madre quedando embarazada de  un niño que hoy en día tiene 1 año, esta mujer pertenece  a una de las tantas familias de bajos recursos, los padres Olmedo y Maria se desempeñan como agricultores, sonia es una mujer que siente satisfacción de creer que a pesar de los obstáculos que tiene en la vida se puede alcanzar los objetivos propuestos. 
Sonia es una mujer  que  sabe valorar los esfuerzos, el apoyo y los logros alcanzados que  le ha  brindado la familia y amigos. 
En este año 2014 se ha propuesto metas claras para continuar el proyecto de vida.

Quiere estudiar en CAMPO ALTO porque es un programa que le brinda una mejor facilidad de pago para realizar los estudios superiores, obtiene beneficios en el campo estudiantil, personal, económico, profesional  y laboral, Ya que por medio del estudio ella podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida, brindando los servicios como profesional en algún hospital. 

Necesita del convenio con kiva porque el valor que tiene que cancelar las cuotas es un poco alto, pero ella no quiere dejar de estudiar porque sabe que esta carrera a futuro le brindara una mejor estabilidad económica, una profesión y podrá sacar adelante todos los proyectos personales y familiares.
texts.en:
Sonia was born on a sidewalk on October 25th.  Since that time she has proven to be an enterprising person with values such as respect, honesty, sincerity, work ethic, and the ability to get ahead.  Despite the obstacles she has faced in life she demonstrates the ability to get ahead and meet the goals she sets.  She started school when she was six years old and in 2010 she became pregnant with her first daughter, who is now four years old.  She took a break from her studies and quickly demonstrated the resolve to continue her education.  She then completed grades 10 and 11 at a school so she could get her high school diploma.

She then decided to become a mother again and became pregnant with a little boy who is now one year old.  This woman belongs to one of the many families with limited resources.  Her parents Olmedo and Maria work as farmers.  Sonia is a woman who is satisfied in the belief that, despite the obstacles that she faces in life, she can achieve the goals she sets. 

Sonia is a woman who knows how to value the effort, support, and advancements that her family and friends have made for her. 

In this year of 2014 she has set clear goals to continue with her lifelong plan.

She wants to study at CAMPO ALTO because it is a program that offers a better payment plan for higher education.  She will receive student, personal. financial, professional, and working benefits, as education will allow her to have a better quality of life through professional work at a hospital. 

She needs a Kiva loan because her payments are a little high, but she does not want to stop studying because she knows that in the future this career will offer her better financial stability, a profession, and the ability to move forward with her personal and family plans.

loans.use: To pay for one semester's enrollment

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es:
Joaquín, es un productor que vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. A sus 40 años y con el apoyo de su compañera de vida y 8 hijos, ha estado dedicado a la producción de granos básicos y café. 

Este pequeño productor está integrado al proceso de certificación de Comercio Justo, y con 3.85 hectáreas de café, logró producir en el último ciclo 136 quintales pergamino. Hasta ahora, él ha estado alquilando un beneficio húmedo para el manejo de su café. Sin embargo, este año se ha propuesto realizar esta inversión si logra conseguir este financiamiento. La construcción de este beneficio le permitirá obtener mejores rendimientos y calidad lo cual contribuirá a incrementar sus ingresos. 

Para Joaquín la buena administración del tiempo y el dinero, así como la adecuada planificación ha sido clave para el crecimiento de su pequeño finca.
texts.en:
Joaquín, is a producer that lives in a community in the north of Nicaragua. At 40 years old, and with the help of his life partner and 8 children, he has made a living producing basic grains and coffee.

This small producer is in the process of getting fair trade certification. With 3.85 hectares of coffee he was able to produce 136 quintals of parchment coffee in the last growing cycle. Up until now he has been renting a wet method processing space to process his coffee. However, this year he is planning to make this investment so long as he gets the loan. The construction of a processing space will allow him to produce better yield and quality, which will contribute to an increase in his income.

For Joaquín, good time and money management as well as adequate planning have been key to the growth of his small farm.

loans.use: to build a wet method processing space.

loans.name: Jimmy Roberto

texts.es: El señor Jimmy de 24 años de edad, casado y padre de un bebé de cinco meses de nacido, es propietario de una mecánica en su domicilio, cuenta con la ayuda de su papá para cambio de repuestos de los clientes, requiere el crédito para invertirlo en repuestos de segunda de automóviles, motos y buses, como es baterías, mangueras, llantas, entre otros, debido a que son lo que mayor demanda la población.
texts.en: Jimmy is 24 years old, married, and the father of a five-month-old baby.  He runs an auto shop in his home.  He has his father's help in replacing parts for his customers.  He needs this loan to invest in used auto, motorcycle, and bus parts, such as batteries, hoses, and tires, among others, because those are what people demand most.

loans.use: to buy auto parts, such as batteries, hoses, tires, etc.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José Francisco, es un productor de café de la zona de Jinotega. Posee aproximadamente 3 hectáreas de café, de las cuales logró obtener una producción de 160 quintales de café pergamino en el último ciclo, el cual está certificado por Comercio Justo.

Su mayor desafío en esta actividad han sido las plagas y enfermedades que afectan este cultivo, las cuales ha logrado mantener bajo control con el mantenimiento adecuado de sus plantaciones. Este pequeño productor menciona que “trabajar bajo las normas de Comercio Justo y cumplir con diligencia las recomendaciones que le brindan los técnicos, es lo que le ha permitido ir mejorando su cafetal”.

Para este ciclo, José Francisco está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que mejorará la nutrición y producción de sus plantas, y con ello la rentabilidad de su cultivo.
texts.en:
José Francisco is a coffee producer in the Jinotega area. He has approximately 3 hectares of coffee where he has been able to produce 160 quintals of parchment coffee in the last growing cycle which is fair trade certified.

His biggest challenge in this occupation has been pests and plagues that affect his crop. He has been able to keep these under control with adequate maintenance of his plants. This small producers states that "working under the fair trade regulations and carrying out with diligence the recommendations made by consultants are what have allowed me to continue improving the coffee farm".

This time José Francisco is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies which which he will improve the nutrients and production of his plants. This will improve the profitability of his crop.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to improve the nutrients and production of his plants.

loans.name: Longeng

texts.en:
Longeng, 29, is married with no kids. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district. The main sources of her family’s income for five years have been from farming rice and repairing motorbikes. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
.  
Longeng has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back her past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy motorbike spare parts for supporting her business. She hopes to make more income from her business to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy motorbike spare parts

loans.name: Tamanno

texts.en: Tamanno is 20 years old. She is a hardworking woman. Tamanno is a student of the first course at the Medical Collage. Tamanno always had a dream of being a doctor. Now, she studies well and tries to learn all subjects for excellence. Tamanno is not married and lives with her parents. Her parents are not able to pay for her tuition. Tamanno is asking for a loan to pay for her tuition in Medical Collage. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Hello everyone! Meet Francis who is 34 years old. He is a mixed farmer in Kitale (Kenya) and a father of four. He is a very passionate farmer who has been practicing for the last three years. He makes money selling milk, eggs and maize. Milking is his hobby and bad weather is his nightmare. He has attended numerous trainings on how to be a good poultry farmer.
 
Francis is seeking your loan to purchase poultry. More poultry will provide additional revenue to level his high farming-related expenses. The additional income will also enable Francis to lead a decent life and meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Ofeira

texts.en:
Ofeira is 25 years old and single with three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu, banana, etc that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. Ofeira needs a loan to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and an axe. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2013. Ofeira will use the profits from her sales to extend her house and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, fillings and an axe

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine, a loving husband and father of five, has been doing farming for eight years now. He lives in Kisii village, an area in Kenya that never goes dry. Dairy farming thrives in this region. Justine enjoys making a living through selling milk and eggs from his farm despite challenges such as the lack of adequate capital. He gets the most milk from 'Brown' (his favourite dairy cow). 

Justine today is here before you seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. He believes asset growth is crucial for any farmer. With an additional income-generating asset, he will raise more capital to meet his farming costs and inputs. With more milk, he will meet the threshold of selling significant amounts to institutions and co-operatives. He chose Kiva because he believes the low interest rate is quite suitable to smallholder farmers from rural areas like himself. His end game is to raise the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sokim's Group

texts.en:
Sokim is 30 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom is in school and the other one is too young for school. Living in a village in the Kandal Steong district, Sokim has been farming rice for almost one year. To earn more income, she has been working as a tailor while her husband works as a construction worker. Together, they manage to earn about 34,000 KHR per day to feed the family. 
 
This is the first loan for Sokim with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes to have a clean latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Vaoesea

texts.en:
Vaoesea is a 54-year-old married woman with three children. She has a plantation where she grows taro, taamu, bananas, and yams which she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than five years. Vaoesea needs a loan to buy bush knives, chemicals, weed sprayer, filings etc. 

She has been a member of SBPD since 2008. Vaoesea will use the profits from her sales to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, filings, etc.

loans.name: Tapa

texts.en:
Tapa is a 54-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro, taamu, banana, and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for more than five years. Tapa needs a loan to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, a chainsaw, filings and an axe. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Tapa will use the profits from her sales to extend her business and support her family as well.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a weed sprayer, bush knives, fillings and an axe

loans.name: Leak's Group

texts.en: Originally a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Bouy is 40 years old, married and blessed with seven children. To support the family, she grows rice as the main source of income and does a paid working job for additional income. She has been engaged in this business for ages and it has earned her 33,300 KHR per day. This is not the first time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid back her past loan with success and now her living conditions are getting better. Now, she is a leader of a group of two to get a new loan. She is applying for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will use her entire loan portion to pay for labor fees and fertilizer, insecticide and seeds for her crop. She hopes to increase her rice crop yield.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees and fertilizer, insecticide and seeds

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en: Makerita is 50 years old, single and a mother with three children. She owns and operates a small store selling daily goods such as flour, sugar, noodles, tinned fish, etc. She has been doing this for four years. Makerita needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, sugar, noodles, boxes of tinned fish, etc and hopes to use her profits to extend her shop to increase her income.  She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, noodles, tinned fish, and corned beef

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is a woman with a kind heart. She lives with her family in a rural area. Nasiba is married and has four children. Her husband is Haydar. Haydar helps her with agricultural activities because Nasiba has been busy growing vegetables and other crops for more than four years. She gets additional income from animal husbandry. Nasiba and her husband work hard to earn a living but they have poor living conditions because of their limited source of income. 

Nasiba is going to sow more vegetables but she doesn't have money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Los Sanchez Group

texts.es: Este grupo está integrado por tres socias exitosas, coordinado por la señora Mariana de 42 años de edad madre soltera de tres hijos de las edades de 21, 15 y 12 años, se dedica a la venta de tortilla con queso o cuajadas y verduras en su domicilio, cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor para elaborar tortillas, esta socia se le ha dado crédito anteriormente y logró hacer un bajarete en su domicilio, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de el quintal de maíz, leña y queso, con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y por ende sus ganancias, de esta manera logrará mejoras en su vida personal y laboral. Las otras socias son la señora Elizabeth de 22 años dedicada a la venta de nacatamales en su domicilio y la señora Margarita propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en: This group is made up of three successful members.  It is coordinated by Mariana, who is 42 years old. She is the single mother of three children, aged 21, 15 and 12. She sells tortillas with cheese or cheese curds and vegetables from her house. Her daughter helps her make the tortillas. She has taken out a loan before and she was able to build a porch on her house. She needs the loan to buy a quintal of corn, firewood and cheese in order to increase her sales and thus her earnings. This way, she can make improvements in her personal and work life. The other members are Elizabeth, aged 22, who sells  de 22 nacatamales from her house, and Margarita, who has a store in her house.

loans.use: to buy a quintal of corn, firewood and cheese.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
José Francisco, es un productor de café de la zona de Jinotega. Posee aproximadamente 3 hectáreas de café, de las cuales logró obtener una producción de 160 quintales de café pergamino en el último ciclo, el cual está certificado por Comercio Justo.

Este pequeño productor menciona que “trabajar bajo las normas de Comercio Justo y cumplir con diligencia las recomendaciones que le brindan los técnicos, es lo que le ha permitido ir mejorando su cafetal”. Don José Francisco cuenta con una solicitud para el mantenimiento de su café, pero en esta ocasión requiere un financiamiento para la construcción de un Beneficio húmedo con lo cual logrará mejorar la calidad de su café y disminuir pérdidas durante el procesamiento.
texts.en:
José Francisco is a coffee grower in the Jinotega area. He has approximately 3 hectares of coffee. He was able to get a harvest of 160 quintals of parchment coffee in the last cycle. It is Fair Trade certified.

This small-scale producer says that working under the Fair Trade rules and diligently complying with the recommendations that the technicians give has allowed him to improve his coffee farm. José Francisco has an application to do maintenance on his coffee, but at this time he needs a loan to build a wet processing system to improve the quality of his coffee and decrease losses during the processing.

loans.use: to build a wet processing system.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima está estudiando para ser odontologa, ella es una persona muy dedicada, que quiere sobresalir en la vida por medio de sus estudios.
Ella quiere ayudar a su familia por medio de su profesión, y es por eso que se está esforzando bastante para poder retribuir a su familia todo lo que ellos dieron por ella.
Fatima pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir las cuotas de la universidad, y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte. Agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo, ya que podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Fatima is studying to become a dentist.  She is very dedicated and wants to get ahead through her education.

She wants to help her family via her profession and so she is making this effort so she can repay them for all they have given her.

Fatima is asking for this loan so she can cover her tuition and also her transportation expenses.  She is grateful for the help she has gotten because it will allow her to continue her education.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Benito

texts.es:
El señor Benito  de 53  años  de edad vive con su conyugue, tiene 1 hijo que dependen de él,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 09 años al negocio de la venta de maíz y maicillo, el también vende leña seca que recoge de sus trabajo de agricultura, sus clientes son los dueños de bodegas en la ciudad de Nacaome. El también trabaja como vigilante en una escuela pública de Nacaome.
Don Benito está solicitando el préstamo para compra de 30 cargas de maíz para reventa ya que esta barato en estos momentos y el desea embodegar para cuando el precio este mejor en el mercado, con el apoyo del crédito el mejorara sus utilidades y por ende tendrá más recursos para atender a sus necesidades familiares.
Don Benito su sueño es mejorar su casa, este es su sexto préstamo que solicita a Prisma y Kiva.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Benito is 53 years old and lives with his partner. Benito has one son who depends on him. Benito owns his own home and, for nine years, has had a business selling corn and sorghum. He also sells dry firewood, which he collects from his agricultural work. Benito's customers are the shop-owners in Nacaome city. Benito also works as a security guard at one of Nacaome's public schools.

Benito is applying for this loan in order to buy 30 loads of corn to sell, as it is currently being sold very cheaply. Benito wants to stock up for when the market price is higher. With the help of this loan, Benito can increase his profits and, as a result, will have more to look after family needs.

Benito's dream is to improve his house. This is his sixth loan application to Prisa Honduras and Kiva.

San Lorenzo, Honduras; March 2014

loans.use: to buy 30 loads of corn for his business.

loans.name: Luis Napoleón

texts.es: Luis es una persona de 54 años de edad, habita en la zona urbana de la ciudad de Juigalpa, desempeña el cargo de guarda de seguridad del zoológico, el cual le ha permitido educar a sus cuatro hijos que ya son personas independientes. Su esposa quien trabaja en una escuela pública de la misma ciudad ha sido su mano derecha  en la familia. Don Luis necesita mejorar las condiciones de su casa que actualmente está construida de un material que no es el adecuado para habitarla, él solicita su primer crédito con el cual comprará materiales de construcción tales como: piedras canteras, arena, hierro y cemento, con ellos realizará un anexo en la parte trasera de su casa.
texts.en: Luis is 54 years old and lives in an urban area in Juigalpa city. He works as a zoo security guard and this job allowed him to bring up his four children, who are now independent adults. Luis's wife works at a public school in the same city and is his right-hand woman in the family. Luis needs to improve his living conditions as his house is made of a material that is not appropriate for living in. Luis is applying for his first loan and will use it to buy building materials such as sand, iron and cement. With these materials Luis will build an extension on the back of his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as sand, iron and cement.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es: Él es Saturnino, vive en unión libre y tiene un hermoso bebe. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 12 años  y  también hace trabajos de albañilería. El crédito solicitado es para comprar mercancía y surtir mejor su tienda. El y su pareja son personas constantes y emprendedoras en busca de mejoras para su familia.  Su logro es la estabilidad y crecimiento de su negocio; su reto  mantener su espíritu de lucha y constancia todos los días para darle un mejor futuro a su bebe.
texts.en: This is Saturinino - he has a partner and a beautiful baby boy. Saturnino has had a grocery store for 12 years and also does building work. This loan will be used to buy merchandise and to stock up his shop better. Saturnino and his partner are enterprising and persevering and looking for better opportunities for their family. Saturnino's acoomplishment is that the business is stable and expanding; his challenge is to keep up his fighting and persevering spirit every day in order to give his baby a better future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and stock up his shop.

loans.name: Laura Vicuña Group

texts.es: El grupo está coordinado por la señora Apolonea, mujer trabajadora de 46 años de edad, viuda y responsable de un niño de 3 años, comercializa frutas y verduras en uno de los mercados capitalinos, este negocio lo impulsó desde hace 25 años y tiene clientela fijas, lo que la motiva a seguir ofreciendo estos productos de calidad, con el crédito invertirá en frutas y verduras de la temporada como es el mango, jocote, papaya, melón, tomate, chiltoma, granadilla, y todo lo relacionado, esta socia con el crédito anterior impulsó el negocio de la crianza de cerdo por lo que se ha propuesto como meta ampliar este negocio para mejorar su nivel en el país, cuenta con la ayuda de su hija de 25 años. Otra de las socias es la señora Jenny de 35 años, comerciante de frutas en el mercado capitalino, la socia  Jazmina de 27 años de edad propietaria de una mueblería en su domicilio y la socia Josefa de 59 años comerciante de frutas y verduras en uno de los mercados de la capital.
texts.en:
This group's coordinator is Apolonea - she is 46 years old and hard working. She is a widow and responsible for her three-year-old son. Apolonea sells fruits and vegetables at one of the capital city's markets. She has been running this business for 25 years and has regular customers, motivating her to continue offering quality products. Apolonea will invest this loan in seasonal fruits and vegetables, such as mangoes, jocotes, papayas, melons, tomatoes, granadillas and other items. This members used her previous loan to start a business raising pigs. She wants to expand this business in order to improve her social level. Aplonea receives help from her 25-year-old daughter.

The other members of the group are Jenny, 35 years old, who also sells fruits at the city market; Jazmina, 27 years old, who runs a furniture store in her house; and 59-year-old Josefa who, again, sells fruits and vegetables at one of the city's markets.

loans.use: to buy mangos and jocotes.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El señor Carmelo de  46  años de edad, vive con su conyugue, tiene  03 hijos  que depende de él, radica en la comunidad la cuesta, san Lorenzo al sur de honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años  al negocio de la venta de maíz, sus clientes son las pulperías y personas que se dedican a la venta de estos productos.
Don Carmelo es un hombre trabajador y con deseos de salir adelante. El esta solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, con el apoyo de este crédito él desea salir adelante, es un buen cliente con varios ciclos de trabajar con prisma paga muy bien sus créditos.
Don Carmelo su sueño es mejorar su casa.
 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014
texts.en:
Carmelo is 46 years old, lives with his life partner, and has three children who are still supported by their father. He lives in the community La Cuesta, San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras. He has a house of his own, and for the last five years he has worked selling corn. His clients are the small grocery stores and retailers.

Don Carmelo is a hardworking man, with a wish to get ahead in life. With the support of this loan, he will be able to do so. He is requesting this loan to buy corn, beans, and rice. He is a good client who meets the loan payments, and has received many loans from Prisma.

Carmelo’s dream is to improve his house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – March, 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, and rice for his business.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
El señor Celestino  de 64  años  de edad vive con su conyugue, no tiene  hijos que dependen de él,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 25 años al negocio de la venta de maíz, cría de ganado, venta de leña seca y cultivo de maíz, sus clientes son los amigos que tiene en la cuidad de Nacaome, son las personas que le compran el maíz y la cuajada que el produce.
Don Celestino es un hombre mayor pero muy trabajador con deseos de salir adelante. Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de cemento, hierro, ladrillo y para ajustar a pagar la mano de obra de un pozo que construye en su propiedad para aguar el ganado y para uso personal ya que no tiene agua potable.
El desea instalar una bomba eléctrica para subir el agua a su casa y tener mejor condición de vida,  es su sexto préstamo que solicita a prisma y Kiva está muy contento por el apoyo a su inversión.
Don Celestino su sueño para este año es construir ese pozo para tener agua en abundancia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Celestino is 64 years old and he lives with his wife. They don't have any dependant children and they live in their own house. For the past 25 years he has made a living selling corn, raising cattle, selling dry wood and growing corn. His customers are friends he has in the city of Nacaome and they are who buy the corn and curd he produces.

Celestino is en elderly man but he has a great desire to get ahead. He is requesting this loan in order to buy cement, iron, bricks, and to pay hired labourers to dig a well on his property in order to provide water for his cattle and for his personal use as he doesn't have drinking water.

He wants to install an electric pump in order to pump water up to his house and improve his living conditions. This is his sixth loan cycle from Prisma and Kiva and he is very happy for the support given to his investment.
 
Celestino's dream is to build this well this year in order to have plenty of water.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron, bricks and to pay hired labourers to dig a well for his house and business.

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias exitosas, coordinado por la señora Cira de 51 años de edad y soltera, propietaria de una mini pulpería y venta de ropa nueva  en su domicilio, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como pantalones de damas, pantalones de caballeros, brazier, sandalias, chinelas de baño, camisetas para caballero, por otra parte comprará frijoles, arroz, pan y más con el fin de ampliar más su negocio, cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos en los gastos de la casa. Otra de las socias es la señora Marling de 41 años de edad comerciante de ropa nueva en su domicilio y la señora Sara de 54 años que ofrece el servicio de venta de nacatamales.
texts.en:
This group consists of three successful members and is managed by Cira, who is 51 years old and single. She owns a small grocery store and sells new clothes from her house. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy products such as  women's trousers, men's trousers, bras, sandals, bathroom slippers, men's t-shirts, and on the other hand she will buy beans, rice, bread and other items in the hope of extending her business. She has the support of her children in the household bills. 

The other members are Marling, who is 41 and sells new clothes from her house and Sara, who is 54 and sells nacatamales.

loans.use: to buy women's trousers, men's trousers, bras, sandals, bathroom slippers, men's t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: La Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es: El grupo “Inmaculada Concepción”  está conformada por  08 mujeres trabajadoras y responsables que buscan mejorar cada día. Benjamina de 52 años es viuda. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Se siente feliz pues este negocio le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda. Más adelante piensa incrementar el volumen de sus productos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar y fideos. Benjamina junto al grupo “Inmaculada Concepción” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Benjamina se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste blusa negra.
texts.en:
The "Immaculate Conception" group is made up of eight hard-working and responsible women who seek to improve themselves each day.  Benjamina is 52 years old, and a widow.  She makes a living selling groceries.  She is happy because this business has allowed her to improve her home.  Later she plans to increase the volume of her products.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy rice, sugar, and noodles.  Benjamina, along with the "Immaculate Conception" group, is grateful to the people who have made this loan possible.  Benjamina is sitting in the photo; she is the first on the left side, wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Fredy Nain

texts.es: Fredy tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su madre y tres hijos de 17 años, 16 años y 15 años de edad. Fredy es un hombre emprendedor, responsable y sobre todo trabajador quien se dedica a la venta de café, leche cocida, pan dulce, sopas, etc. Tiene dos años de contar con este negocio y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el negocio a su hogar.
