Su deseo es seguir manteniendo su negocio por mucho más tiempo dado que desea dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Es por lo anterior que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio en la compra de café, azúcar, leche, pan dulce, sopas, etc. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento ya que no cuenta con el capital disponible para hacer el desembolso por su cuenta.
texts.en: Fredy is 38 years old and lives in his own house, together with his mother and his three children aged 17, 16, and 15. Fredy is entrepreneurial, responsible and above all, hardworking. He sells coffee, cooked milk, sweet bread, soups, etc. He has had this business for two years and this is how he makes a living and brings business to his home. His wish is to continue with the business for a long time, since he wants to give his family better living conditions. This is why he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in his business by buying coffee, sugar, milk, sweet bread, soups, etc. He hopes to be able to count on this loan, as he doesn't have the capital available to make the disbursement himself.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, milk, sweet bread, soups, etc.

loans.name: Delmis Marina

texts.es:
La señora Delmis  de 41  años de edad,   tiene 2  hijos   que dependan  de ella, vive con su conyugue en su casa propia,  ubicada en la comunidad de la criba, al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 15  años al negocio de venta de pan de todas las clases sus clientes son los amigos, vecinos, escuelas, pulperías, y personas que comercializan con este producto.
Doña Delmis sale junto con su esposo en su carro a vender por los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo y lugares aledaños, Doña  Delmis es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de superarse lo que desea en la vida es ver que su familia prospere y salga adelante.
Doña Delmis esta solicitando el préstamo para compra  de harina, huevos, azúcar, manteca, levadura y otra materia prima  que necesita.  El préstamo los solicita para  mejorar su negocio, porque no tiene suficiente  harina y huevos.  Con el apoyo del préstamo  ella pretende mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con PRISMA y KIVA.
Doña Delmis Su sueño es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Marzo del 2014.
texts.en:
Delmis is 41 years old, she has 2 children who depend on her. She lives with her partner in her own house, located in the community of La Criba, in the south of Honduras. She has made a living selling all types of bread for the past 15 years. Her customers are her friends, neighbours, schools, grocery stores and people who sell this product.

Delmis goes out to sell with her husband in the neighbourhoods and colonies of San Lorenzo and the surrounding areas. Delmis is a hard working woman who has a great desire to excel. She hopes to see her family prosper and get ahead.

Delmis is requesting this loan to buy flour, eggs, sugar, butter, yeast and other raw materials she needs. This loan is to improve her business as she doesn't have enough flour and eggs. With the help of this loan she will improve her income and therefore her quality of life. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, butter, yeast and other raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Hay Vida En Jesus Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario está coordinado por el señor Javier de 29 años de edad, soltero, es comerciante de productos AVON desde hace seis años, cuenta con la ayuda de su mamá en la comercialización de los productos, el crédito lo quiere para la compra de productos como es pintura labial, pintura de uñas, perfumes de damas, perfumes para caballeros, cremas para la piel, cremas para el cabello y más. Otro de los socios es la señora Dania de 27 años de edad dedicada a la venta de ropa de segunda en los mercados capitalinos, y el señor Julio de 38 años quien ofrece refrescos y tortillas en las principales calles de su comunidad.
texts.en: This solidarity group is coordinated by Javier, who is 29 years old and single. He has had a business for six years selling AVON products. He has the help of his mother in selling these products. He is requesting the loan to buy products such as lipstick, nail polish, women perfumes, men perfumes, body creams, hair creams and more. Another partner is Dania, 27 years old, who sells used clothing in the capital's markets and Julio, 38 years old, who has a business selling beverages and tortillas in the main streets of his community.

loans.use: To buy lipstick, nail polish, women perfumes, men perfumes, body creams, hair creams and more

loans.name: Sothorn

texts.en:
Sothorn is aged 36 and married with three children. Her family lives in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava. Having been in this business for 12 years, they can earn about 70,000 KHR per day. 

Sothorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loan has helped her family relieve their financial burden to a great extent. She is now applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for labor fees

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan is 53 years old and a married mother of seven children. To cover her family’s expense, she does rice farming and runs a small rice-grinding business for income. She has been engaged with the current business for 15 years and she can earn a decent income. 

Now, she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader. Her past loans enabled her to uplift her condition of living and she has fully repaid them. She and her joint borrower are third-time borrowers and they are requesting a loan with the same amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. 

Yan will manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds and to pay for labor costs. She hopes to gain a better crop yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and seeds and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Bibizulaykho

texts.en:
Bibizulaykho is a married parent of five children. She lives with her husband and children in a rural area, near to mountains. 

Bibizulaykho has been busy with growing watermelon, cotton, etc.for more than 20 years. She has great experience. Her husband and children help her with growing agricultural products. Bibizulaykho grows agricultural products on a four-hector plot of land and usually gets a good profit. 

She is going to make new sowing but she has not enough savings for it. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 USD to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel, etc. From the profit she is going to improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, fuel, etc.

loans.name: Real Sociedad Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario lo integran cuatro socias trabajadoras y coordinado por la señora Josefa de 23 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 6 y 2 años, es comerciante de cosechas y cuenta con la ayuda de su compañero en la compra de las cosechas, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de frutas de la temporada como es el aguacate, jocote, mango y níspero. Las otras socias son la señora Julia de 45 años quien ofrece el servicio de comida en el mercado más populoso de la capital y venta de nacatamales en su domicilio, la señora Juana de 34 años dedicada a la compra-venta de cosechas, y la señora Sugey de 34 años dedicada a la venta de nacatamales.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of four hardworking members and coordinated by Señora Josefa.  She is 23 years old and in a relationship.  She is the mother of two children, ages 2 and 6.  She sells crops; her partner helps her in buying the crops.  She needs the loan to buy seasonal fruits such as avocados, jocote fruit, mangos, and loquats.  

The other group members are Julia, age 45, who offers meals in the busiest market of the capital and sells nacatamales (traditional Nicaraguan tamales) from her home; Juana, age 34, who works buying and selling crops; and Sugey, age 34, who sells nacatamales.

loans.use: to buy avocados and jocote fruit

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
Chanthorn is resident of Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 48 years old and a mother of two children. The main source of her income is rice farming, which she has done for 15 years. She can earn extra income via a paid-working job during her spare time. 

This is a fourth-cycle loan and she is the leader. Her three past loans have helped her to improve her lifestyle and she completely repaid them. Now, she and her joint borrower are seeking loans of 1,400,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for labor fees for her rice field. She highly hopes that she will produce more crop than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Sodany's Group

texts.en:
Sodany, 39, lives in a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. 

For the last 10 years, Sodany has been farming rice, selling grocery items and working for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Sodany is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and to pay labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her business to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Faeza

texts.en:
Faeza is an Iraqi widowed woman, age 54 years. She has three children and she works to provide the family income.
 
Faeza is a seamstress and has her own modest workshop at home. She has practiced tailoring since she was a child. In 2012, she started providing tailoring services from her house for living purposes. She gained great experience in this field and she provides good quality with great prices.

Faeza is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD. She will use this loan to buy a specialized sewing machine. She believes that with this loan, she will be able to grow her business and increase her profits. The most important is that she will be able to provide her children a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a specialized sewing machine.

loans.name: Doeun Group

texts.en: Doeun is 33 years old. She is a married woman who has two children and lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Doeun is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Doeun hopes that she can open a retail grocery shop, build a new house and that her children can get bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine.

loans.name: Yeny Marisol

texts.es: Yeny tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su querida hija. Yeny se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace mucho tiempo. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y en su lugar de habitación es así como junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Yeny y su familia no cuentan con el servicio de agua potable en su hogar de habitación y se abastecen por medio de un pozo que tiene en su terreno para lo cual ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para comprar una bomba que le facilite extraer el agua del pozo que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en: Yeny is 21 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their beloved daughter. Yeny has been working selling beauty products for a long time. She sells them in the street, and this is how she maintains her home economy together with her husband. Yeny and her family do not have drinking water in their home. Their water is supplied by a well on their land, which is why they made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI to buy a pump that will allow them to more easily get the water that they need so badly from the well.

loans.use: to buy a water pump, tubes, and cables.

loans.name: Chiriku Group

texts.en:
Winfrida, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two kids, one of whom goes to school while the other one is still small. She has been running a grocery store since 2004.  She works from 4 p.m. to 11 p.m. during the weekdays and 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. during the weekend. She is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Winfrida's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy chairs, tables, and increase the stock of her grocery inventory. She has paid back all of her loans successfully, and she is grateful for the loans. She used the profit to pay for school fees, buy a plot of land, and cover household expenses. 

Winfrida will use this loan to buy beer, soda, juice, water, wine and spirits. Her dream is to own a big grocery store and to finish her house, which she has started building.

Winfrida will share this loan with her loan group "Chiriku" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loans.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, juice, water, wine and spirits.

loans.name: Hacienda Chacrasana Group

texts.es: El grupo “HACIENDA CHACRASANA”  esta conformada por 09 mujeres empeñosas y tajadoras que luchan día a día para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Liliana tiene 36 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos educando. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños y adultos en forma ambulatoria. Y a la vez presta servicios domestico hace 04 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas ropas polos blusas short y buzos. Su mayor deseo es construir su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Liliana es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
The Hacienda Chacrasana group is made up of 9 hardworking and persevering women who fight from day to day to give a better quality of life to their families.  

Liliana is 36 years old.  She has a live-in partner and two children who are students.  She works as a mobile vendor of adult and children’s clothing.  At the same time, she has offered her services as a domestic for four years.  She will invest her loan in the purchase of more clothing: polo shirts, tops, shorts, and sportswear.  Her greatest desire is to build a home.  

The group is thankful to Kiva investors for the loan that was given to them.  Liliana is seated, the first person from the right hand side.

loans.use: to buy more clothing: polo shirts, tops, shorts, and sportswear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials, specifically quarry stone, cement and iron, and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 50 years old, married, and has three children. She organized her own business three months ago. She owns a store, which is based in a local market. Here she sells dishes, such as plates, cups, bowls, kettles, etc.
 
To improve the business, she is borrowing 1,000 USD from Imon International to buy a variety of dishes for her new business. In this way she is going to develop business and maximize profit. She’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding her business before long.

loans.use: To buy a variety of dishes

loans.name: El Eucalipto Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario lo integran tres socios laboriosos, coordinado por el señor Jonathan de 21 años de edad, casado, se dedica a comercializar leña a domicilio, es un negocio heredado por su papá y el cuál cuenta con la ayuda de él en la cortada de este producto, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de leña por marca o carreta, compra de una motosierra y combustible. Otra de las socias es la señora Keylin de 19 años comerciante de verduras en el mercado municipal, y la señora Marlene de 50 años que vende productos derivados de maíz como es tamales, pinol, tamales rellenos, etc.
texts.en: This supportive group has three hardworking members coordinated by Jonathan. He is 21 years old, married, and works selling domestic firewood. It's a business he inherited from his father and depends on his help cutting the product. The loan he requires is to buy firewood by the bundle or by the cart, a power saw, and fuel. Others members are Keylin who is 19 and sells vegetables in the municipal market, and Marlene who is 50 sells products derived from corn like tamales, pinol, stuffed tamales, etc.

loans.use: to buy a cart of firewood and a power saw.

loans.name: Las Morenas Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro socias exitosas en sus negocios, coordinado por la señora Martha de 29 años de edad, acompañada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de 10 y 5 años, esta socia se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas, y este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de jocotes y mangos principalmente por ser las frutas que más se demandan en esta temporada, cuenta con el apoyo de su compañero para la comercialización de estos productos. Otra de las socias es la señora María de 32 años comerciante de leña, leche y hamacas en su domicilio y lugares cercanos a su comunidad, la señora Yelba de 29 años comerciante de leña y cosechas de tamarindo, y la señora María de 43 años propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio y también compra y vende frutas como es el jocote y el tamarindo.
texts.en: This solidarity group is composed of four partners who are successful in their businesses. The group is coordinated by Martha, 29, who is a married mother of two children ages 10 and 5 years. Martha sells fruits and vegetables and will invest this loan in the purchase of produce. She will mainly be buying plums and mangoes because they will be most in demand this season. She has the support of her partner in selling these products. Another group member is Maria, 32, who sells firewood, milk, and hammocks at home and in places near her community. Yelba, 29, sells firewood and tamarind. Maria, 43, owns a grocery store at home and also buys and sells produce such as cauliflower and tamarind.

loans.use: to purchase plums and mangoes.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy is a villager living in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 21 years old and single. To support her daily cost of living, she does cassava farming as the main source of income, and she also sells grocery items for supplemental income. 

This is the first-cycle loan for Chanthy and the third loan for her group member. She and the other group member are requesting a loan in the same amount of 500,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, Chanthy will spend her loan portion to buy insecticide, fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her field. She strongly believes that she will harvest more cassava than before.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, fertilizer and cassava seedlings for her field.

loans.name: Remie

texts.en:
Meet 44-year-old Remie from Waterloo in the Western rural area of Freetown. She is married with 6 children. One of her children is currently attending school. She established her retail business 15 years ago. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to take care of her family. 

She works at the business from 8:00am till 5:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the transportation problem within her area of operation.

Remie requires a loan in order to purchase more food containers, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of her family's welfare and increase her business. In the future, Remie plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more food containers, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Sorphea's Group

texts.en:
Aged 33 years, Sorphea is married and lives with her family in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of six children. Two are in school while the other four are too young for school. 

To make a living, she has been raising pigs and selling grocery items for 13 years. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHR40,000 per day from the current business and are able to save about KHR20,000 each day for the future. 

This is the first loan for Sorphea’s group with VisionFund. As the leader, she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan of 1,000,000KHR each. Sorphea wants to use her portion to buy more piglets and pig feeds. She hopes to fatten her pigs so as to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and pig feeds.

loans.name: San Antonio De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: Viviana es socia del grupo “SAN ANTONIO DE JICAMARCA” .Ella tiene 43 años de edad es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica hace 20 años a la crianza de cerdo y a la vez a la  fabricación de ladrillos para luego expenderlos al  por mayor y  menor. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos de sus cerdos. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio de ladrillos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Viviana es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo de color melón.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the “SAN ANTONIO DE JICAMARCA”  group. She is 43 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 independent children. For 20 years she has made a living raising pigs as well as making bricks, which she then sells through wholesale and retail channels.

She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. Her main dream is to expand her brick business. 

The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the provision of the loan. 

Viviana is the third from the right in the melon coloured t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal is 34 years old. She is a married woman who has five children and lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers and one of her children is a construction worker. All of them can earn approximately $20 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in better conditions. In the future, Phal hopes that her family can live in happiness.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine.

loans.name: Luna Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario lo integran tres socias exitosas en sus labores cotidianos, coordinado por la señora Francis de  39 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos de las edades de15 y 9 años, dedicada a la venta de cosmético desde hace diez años, es por este motivo que requiere el crédito para aumentar la mercadería en productos como perfumes de damas, perfumes de caballeros, boddy, pinturas labial, pinturas de uñas, delineadores, rubor, sombras y más. Otra integrante es la señora Miriam de 53 años comerciante de zapatos para damas y caballeros, y la señora Ivana de 30 años propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
This support group is made up of three members who are successful in their daily work. The group is led by Francis, aged 39, who is married and has two children aged 15 and 9 years.  For 10 years she has made a living selling cosmetics.

This is the reason why she needs a loan to increase her stock of products such as men's and ladies' perfumes, body lotion, lipstick, nail varnish, eyeliner, blusher, eyeshadows and other items. 

53-year-old Miriam is one of the other members and sells men's and women's shoes. Ivania, who is 30 years old, runs a small grocery store in her home.

loans.use: to buy products such as men's and ladies' perfumes, body lotion, lipstick, nail varnish, eyeliner, blusher, eyeshadows and other items.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 58 years old and a widow with seven children. She works selling women's clothing commonly known as bitenge. Marie has received a previous loan that she successfully used to rebuild her business. 

Marie is requesting a loan to buy more bitenge to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to reinvest in her business.  Marie is very thankful.

loans.use: to buy bitenge clothing to sell

loans.name: Hamzakhon

texts.en:
Hamzakhon is repeat client of IMON. She is a kind and responsible woman. Hamzakhon is married and has three children. Two of them are non-adults. Eight years ago, Hamzakhon began her one business. She sells a variety of salads in a local market. She manages with the business alone. 

Hamzakhon is going to increase her working capital because there is a great demand for salads in the local market because people always use salads. She is asking for a loan of 2,700 Somoni to buy vegetables and other ingredients for making and selling more salads. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and other ingredients for making and selling more salads

loans.name: Cantares Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario lo integran tres socias trabajadoras, coordinado por la señora Lillyam de 41 años de edad, acompañada y madre de tres hijos de las edades de 22, 20 y 19 años, se dedica a la compra-venta de frutas, este negocio lo adquirió desde hace ocho años y cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de cosechas de tamarindo, jocote, mango y tomate, otro ingreso que ella obtiene es que trabaja de doméstica, para así aumentar los ingresos de su hogar. También lo integra la señora Candida de 55 años comerciante de frutas y verduras en los mercados del país, y la señora Alma de 33 años que ofrece artesanías de bambú.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three hardworking members and is coordinated by Señora Lillyam.  She is 41 years old and in a relationship.  She is the mother of three children, ages 19, 20, and 22.  She works buying and selling fruit.  She got this business eight years ago and counts on the help of her children.  She needs this loan to buy tamarinds, jocote fruit, mangos, and tomatoes.  Another source of income that she has is working as a domestic, in order to increase the income in her household.  

Señora Candida, age 55, is also a member.  She is a fruit and vegetable vendor in the country’s markets.  Señora Alma, age 33, sells bamboo handicrafts.

loans.use: to buy mangos and jocote fruit

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Channy is 39 years old and a mother of two school age kids. To overcome her financial burden, her main source of income is a clothing tailoring business. She is working as a paid worker for extra income. 

She has been engaged with this current business for ages, and it has generated a decent income. Now, she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and to get the loan she is the leader of a two-member group. She has paid back her past loan with success and it has improved her household to be better than before.

She and her joint borrower are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fabric, thread and a tailoring machine to support her tailoring business. She hopes to improve her lifestyle and to expand her business to a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and a tailoring machine.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Phun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Phun is aged 62 years and married with five children. For more than 40 years, she and her husband have been farming rice and selling grocery items as the primary sources of the family’s income. To make a living they can earn about KHR70,000 per day and manage to save about KHR30,000 each day for future needs. 

Phun has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Phun will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her farmland to increase her rice farming production to make more rice to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.
